original: rkyen ni bzhi po dag tu gsungs //üîΩgang nas gsungs @303b zhes bya ba ni mdo las sam /
analyzed: rkyen ni bzhi po dag tu gsungs // gang nas gsungs @303b zhes bya ba ni mdo las sam /
translated: The conditions are said to be four.üîΩFrom where are they said?

original: 'on te chos mngon pa bdag gis mngon pa las gsungs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te chos mngon pa bdag gis mngon pa las gsungs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From the sutras or from the Abhidharma?

original: de'i phyir mdo las zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says: in the sutras.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is the explanation:

original: bcom ldan 'das kho nas bstan gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kho nas bstan gyi /
translated: only the Lord taught them,

original: chos mngon pa bdag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos mngon pa bdag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: not the Abhidharma master.

original: rkyen du 'dra ba ni rkyen nyid do ;
analyzed: rkyen du 'dra ba ni rkyen nyid do ;
translated: The conditionality of the similar is the conditionality of the similar.

original: /'dir dngos po'i rkyen gyis bstan pa ni 'dra ba nye bar blangs pa'o //
analyzed: /'dir dngos po'i rkyen gyis bstan pa ni 'dra ba nye bar blangs pa'o //
translated: Here, the teaching of the conditionality of things is the taking up of the similar.

original: thams cad rang bzhin tha dad pa yin yang rkyen gyi dngos po las mi 'da' ste rkyen gyi rigs rnam pa bzhi brten to snyam du bsam pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad rang bzhin tha dad pa yin yang rkyen gyi dngos po las mi 'da' ste rkyen gyi rigs rnam pa bzhi brten to snyam du bsam pa'o //
translated: Although all things are different by nature, they do not go beyond the state of conditionality, and the four kinds of conditions are relied upon.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba rgyu lnga yin zhes bya ba la rgyu'i rkyen ni lnga kho na ste rgyu'i rkyen kho na lnga ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba rgyu lnga yin zhes bya ba la rgyu'i rkyen ni lnga kho na ste rgyu'i rkyen kho na lnga ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause is said to be the five causes. The causal condition is just the five causes, not just the causal condition.

original: de dag kyang mi shes pas byed rgyu'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi shes pas byed rgyu'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since they are not known, the root text states, ‚Äúwith the exception of the active cause.‚ÄùüîΩHow do you know that the active cause is not a causal condition?

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu rgyu'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes par bya zhe na bstan bcos las rgyu'i rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu rgyu'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes par bya zhe na bstan bcos las rgyu'i rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge states, ‚ÄúWhat is a causal condition?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is all conditioned entities.‚Äù

original: chos 'dus byas smos pas rgyu'i rkyen ni lnga po dag yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: chos 'dus byas smos pas rgyu'i rkyen ni lnga po dag yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Since conditioned entities are mentioned, the causal condition is the five causes.

original: sems dang sems byung skyes pa rnams //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung skyes pa rnams //
translated: Arisen minds and mental factors

original: tha ma min mtshungs de ma thag / ces bya ba la /üîΩsems dang sems las byung ba smos pas /
analyzed: tha ma min mtshungs de ma thag / ces bya ba la / sems dang sems las byung ba smos pas /
translated: are the equivalent immediately preceding condition, except for the final mind.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúminds and mental factors‚Äù excludes form, nonassociated formative factors, and unconditioned states.

original: gzugs dang 'dus ma byas dang ldan pa ma yin pa bsal ba'i sgo nas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid ni ma yin gyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid ni ma yin no zhes shes par
analyzed: gzugs dang 'dus ma byas dang ldan pa ma yin pa bsal ba'i sgo nas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid ni ma yin gyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid ni ma yin no zhes shes par
translated: The phrase ‚Äúexcept for the final mind‚Äù indicates that minds and mental factors are equivalent immediately preceding conditions.

original: bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of action.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'dus ma byas rgyu'i rkyen yin zhe na mi sgrib pa tsam gyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'dus ma byas rgyu'i rkyen yin zhe na mi sgrib pa tsam gyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Again, why is the unconditioned a condition as cause? Because it is a mere nonobstruction.

original: gang dag rgyu dang rkyen gyi rnam par rtog pa rnams rgyu lnga dang rkyen gsum gyis ma bsdus pa nyid aa sam skri ta sta ta sam gra h'artham /
analyzed: gang dag rgyu dang rkyen gyi rnam par rtog pa rnams rgyu lnga dang rkyen gsum gyis ma bsdus pa nyid aa sam skri ta sta ta sam gra h'artham /
translated: Those who imagine conditions as causes are not included in the five causes and three conditions, and they are included in the meaning of the non-associated compositional factor.

original: byed rgyu dang bdag po'i rkyen rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: byed rgyu dang bdag po'i rkyen rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The active cause and the dominant condition are posited.

original: dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs pa bzhin rnam par rtog pa rnam pa du ma nyid kyi phyir byed rgyu las zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs pa bzhin rnam par rtog pa rnam pa du ma nyid kyi phyir byed rgyu las zhes pa'o //
translated: Because the various aspects of conceptualization are many, it is like the active cause.

original: sems dang sems 'byung skyes pa rnams /
analyzed: sems dang sems 'byung skyes pa rnams /
translated: The active cause is the cause of the arising of minds and mental factors.

original: tha ma min mtshungs de ma thag ces bya ba la ;
analyzed: tha ma min mtshungs de ma thag ces bya ba la ;
translated: The final is not the equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: ('dus ma byas te bsdus pa'i don/) sems dang sems las byung ba smos pas gzugs dang 'dus ma byas dang ldan pa med pa ma yin pa rnams bsal ba'i sgo nas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen no zhesüîΩshes par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsems dang @304a * //
analyzed: ('dus ma byas te bsdus pa'i don/) sems dang sems las byung ba smos pas gzugs dang 'dus ma byas dang ldan pa med pa ma yin pa rnams bsal ba'i sgo nas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro // sems dang @304a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmind and mental factors‚Äù excludes form and non-compounded phenomena, and indicates that only mind and mental factors are equivalent immediately preceding conditions.

original: sems las byung ba dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems las byung ba dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Mind and mental factors are of two types:

original: tha ma dang tha ma ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: tha ma dang tha ma ma yin pa dag go //
translated: final and not final.

original: tha ma dag ni gang dag gi mjug thogs su sems dang sems las byung ba mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: tha ma dag ni gang dag gi mjug thogs su sems dang sems las byung ba mi 'byung ste /
translated: Final minds and mental factors are those that do not give rise to subsequent minds and mental factors.

original: dper na dgra bcom pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dus kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dgra bcom pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dus kyi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, this is like the final mind and mental factors of an arhat who is in the process of attaining nirvana.

original: tha ma ma yin pa dag ni gang dag gi mjug thogs su sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: tha ma ma yin pa dag ni gang dag gi mjug thogs su sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba'o //
translated: Not final minds and mental factors are those that give rise to subsequent minds and mental factors.

original: de'i phyir tha ma bsal ba'i sgo nas phyi ma dang bcas pa rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir tha ma ma yin pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha ma bsal ba'i sgo nas phyi ma dang bcas pa rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir tha ma ma yin pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúnot the final‚Äù is stated in order to understand that those having a subsequent state are similar by way of excluding the final.

original: skyes pa rnams zhes bya bas ni ma 'ongs pa bsal ba'i sgo nas 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams zhes bya bas ni ma 'ongs pa bsal ba'i sgo nas 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that have arisen‚Äù indicates that the present and past are included by way of excluding the future.

original: rkyen 'di ni mtshungs pa yang yin de ma thag pa yang yin pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i don dang ldan pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rkyen 'di ni mtshungs pa yang yin de ma thag pa yang yin pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i don dang ldan pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: This condition is both similar and immediately antecedent. This shows that only minds and mental factors have the meaning of similar and immediately antecedent.

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin pas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin pas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Since others do not, minds and mental factors are the similar and immediately antecedent condition.

original: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyud gcig la rdzas rigs mthun pa gnyis mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyud gcig la rdzas rigs mthun pa gnyis mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similar means that two substances of the same type are similar in one continuum.

original: de ma thag tu zhes bya ba rdzas rigs mthun pas bar du ma chod pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag tu zhes bya ba rdzas rigs mthun pas bar du ma chod pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Immediately is a result that is not obstructed by a homogeneous substance.

original: gang dag par med par 'brel par 'byung ba ni de ma thag pa zhes smra ba de dag gi ltar na snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams de ma thag pa zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag par med par 'brel par 'byung ba ni de ma thag pa zhes smra ba de dag gi ltar na snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams de ma thag pa zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who say that immediately means arising in a related but not simultaneous way would have to say that the mind and mental factors that arise from meditative attainment are immediately antecedent conditions.

original: thams cad mtshungs pa 'am cig car kho nar sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs sngon du 'gro ba nyid do //üîΩde gzhan dag gis bar ma chad pa'i rkyen yin pas mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen no zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: thams cad mtshungs pa 'am cig car kho nar sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs sngon du 'gro ba nyid do // de gzhan dag gis bar ma chad pa'i rkyen yin pas mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen no zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: All are similar or simultaneous.

original: mi mnyam par 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi mnyam par 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: Others say that it is an immediately antecedent condition because it is a condition that is not obstructed by another.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i don med pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no ;
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i don med pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no ;
translated: It is not an immediately antecedent condition because it does not have the meaning of similarity.

original: / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i don med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i don med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the meaning of ‚Äúsimilar and immediately antecedent‚Äù is untenable,

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThus, in the desire realm, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni so so thar ba'i sdom pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni so so thar ba'i sdom pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The form of the prƒÅtimok·π£a restraint is experienced in the desire realm.

original: gzugs na spyod pa ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The form of the meditative restraint is experienced in the form realm.

original: @304b zag pa med pa ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i gzugs so //üîΩgang gi tshe sdom pa blangs pa bsam gtan nam lam la snyoms par mi 'jug pa de'i tshe ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs las 'dod pa na spyod pa kho na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: @304b zag pa med pa ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i gzugs so // gang gi tshe sdom pa blangs pa bsam gtan nam lam la snyoms par mi 'jug pa de'i tshe ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs las 'dod pa na spyod pa kho na 'byung ngo //
translated: The form of the uncontaminated restraint is uncontaminated.üîΩWhen one who has taken the restraint does not enter meditative absorption in the meditative states or the path, then the uncontaminated form experienced in the desire realm arises only in the desire realm.

original: gang gi tshe bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa de'i tshe na 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa de'i tshe na 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'byung ngo //
translated: When one enters meditative absorption in the meditative states, then the uncontaminated form experienced in the desire realm and the form realm arises.

original: gang gi tshe lam la snyoms par 'jug pa de'i tshe ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa 'byung bas gzugs mngon du 'gyur bas 'chol ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe lam la snyoms par 'jug pa de'i tshe ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa 'byung bas gzugs mngon du 'gyur bas 'chol ba yin no //
translated: When one enters the path of meditative development, then the form realm and the formless realm manifest, since the desire realm and the uncontaminated arise.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni 'chol ba ma yin na zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi mjug thogs su ni nam yang 'dod par gtogs pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni 'chol ba ma yin na zhes bya ba la / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi mjug thogs su ni nam yang 'dod par gtogs pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is not mixed.üîΩImmediately after a mind and mental factors of the desire realm, those belonging to the desire realm and those belonging to the form realm never arise.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Immediately after a mind and mental factors of the form realm, those belonging to the form realm and those belonging to the formless realm never arise.üîΩImmediately after a mind and mental factors of the formless realm, those belonging to the formless realm and those belonging to the desire realm never arise.üîΩImmediately after a mind and mental factors of the uncontaminated realm, those belonging to the uncontaminated realm and those belonging to the desire realm never arise.

original: gang dag mtshungs pa de ma thag tu byung ba de dag ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: gang dag mtshungs pa de ma thag tu byung ba de dag ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: Others say: Those that arise as the equivalent and immediate antecedent are the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent.

original: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ldan pa de ldan pa nyid de /
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ldan pa de ldan pa nyid de /
translated: Equivalent means that which possesses, possesses.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dang yang dag par ldan pa ni yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dang yang dag par ldan pa ni yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: That which possesses feeling and so on is possession.

original: de ma thag pa zhes bya ba ni cig car sems la tshor ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ma thag pa zhes bya ba ni cig car sems la tshor ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The term immediately preceding refers to the simultaneous arising of minds and mental factors, not to the nature of feeling and so on.

original: sems gcig la 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa mngon du gyur pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: sems gcig la 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa mngon du gyur pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you assert that the simultaneous arising of minds and mental factors is the immediately preceding condition, then it would be impossible for desire and nondesire to manifest in a single mind.

original: 'di mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: This is not the immediately preceding condition.

original: btsun pa dbyig bshes na re rgyas pa las byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: btsun pa dbyig bshes na re rgyas pa las byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Bhadanta Vasumitra explains:

original: ji ltar zas dang bsam gtan la sogs pas rgyas par byas pa dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma 'gags pa kho nar de dang rigs mthun pa bsam gtan dang zas la sogs pas rgyas pa dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i gzugs gzhan skye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar zas dang bsam gtan la sogs pas rgyas par byas pa dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma 'gags pa kho nar de dang rigs mthun pa bsam gtan dang zas la sogs pas rgyas pa dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i gzugs gzhan skye ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as food and the absorptions and so on act as conditions that enhance, so too, form derived from enhancement and form derived from karmic maturation arise from the enhancement of other similar states such as the absorptions and food, even though they have not ceased.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems ma 'gags pa kho nar dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems ni mi 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems ma 'gags pa kho nar dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems ni mi 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: and that a virtuous, nonvirtuous, or indeterminate mind does not arise from a virtuous, nonvirtuous, or indeterminate mind that has not ceased.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: de ltar 'byung ba chen po bzhi las skyes pa rnams ni rigs gcig pa mang po nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs kyis rdul phra rab kyi rdzas rnams skye'i //üîΩsems @305a * //
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba chen po bzhi las skyes pa rnams ni rigs gcig pa mang po nye bar blangs pa'i gzugs kyis rdul phra rab kyi rdzas rnams skye'i // sems @305a * //
translated: The substances of atoms arise from the four great elements that arise in that way, but they are not derived from a single type of great element, because form that is derived from a great element is derived from many great elements.

original: dang sems las byung ba rnams ni ma yin pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dang sems las byung ba rnams ni ma yin pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: But mind and mental factors are not like that.

original: btsun pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa gnas brtan chos skyob bo //
analyzed: btsun pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa gnas brtan chos skyob bo //
translated: Bhadanta is the elder DharmatrƒÅta of the SautrƒÅntika school.

original: ches mang ba dang / nyung du byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ches mang ba dang / nyung du byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Because they arise in greater and lesser numbers.

original: 'di ltar chos gzugs can rnams ni rdzas nges pa med par 'byung bar 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gzugs can rnams ni rdzas nges pa med par 'byung bar 'gal ba med de /
translated: Because it is not contradictory for physical phenomena to arise without a definite number of substances.

original: la lar ni ches nyung ngu mang por 'gyur te /
analyzed: la lar ni ches nyung ngu mang por 'gyur te /
translated: In some cases, a small number becomes a greater number.

original: dper na nur nur po la sogs pa dag las gzugs lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nur nur po la sogs pa dag las gzugs lta bu'o //
translated: For example, form arises from the kalala stage and so on.

original: la lar ni ches mang ba yang nyung dur 'gyur te /
analyzed: la lar ni ches mang ba yang nyung dur 'gyur te /
translated: Sometimes, what is greater becomes less,

original: dper na stobs dang ldan pa'i lus las stobs chung du 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na stobs dang ldan pa'i lus las stobs chung du 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: for example, when a weak person arises from a strong person.

original: de'i phyir 'di mtshungs pa de ma thag pa nyid kyi byed pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di mtshungs pa de ma thag pa nyid kyi byed pa med do //
translated: Therefore, this is not the equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: sems las byung ba rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: As for the mental factors,

original: 'di ltar 'dod par gtogs pa'i dge ba'i sems la sems las byung ba nyi shu rtsa gnyis 'byung la mi dge ba ma 'dres pa dang / lta ba dang ldan pa la nyi shu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod par gtogs pa'i dge ba'i sems la sems las byung ba nyi shu rtsa gnyis 'byung la mi dge ba ma 'dres pa dang / lta ba dang ldan pa la nyi shu'o //
translated: thus twenty-two mental factors arise in a virtuous mind belonging to the desire realm, twenty in a nonvirtuous and unmixed mind and in a mind possessing view.

original: bsgribs pa la ni bco brgyad do //
analyzed: bsgribs pa la ni bco brgyad do //
translated: Eighteen arise in an obscured mind.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa la ni bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa la ni bcu gnyis so //
translated: Twelve arise in an unobscured neutral mind.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gtan dang po'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gtan dang po'o //
translated: The concentration of the first absorption possesses investigation and analysis.

original: rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam ni bsam gtan khyad par can no //
analyzed: rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam ni bsam gtan khyad par can no //
translated: The concentration of the special absorption possesses analysis alone and not investigation.

original: rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar te /
analyzed: rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar te /
translated: The second absorption and so on up to the summit of existence are devoid of investigation and analysis.

original: sems dang ting nge 'dzin de dag phan tshun mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bor 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: sems dang ting nge 'dzin de dag phan tshun mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bor 'dod pa yin la /
translated: They assert that mind and concentration are equivalent in being the essence of the equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: sems las byung ba rnams kyang ches mang ba dang nyung du 'byung bas gzugs bzhin du mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por 'gal lo //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams kyang ches mang ba dang nyung du 'byung bas gzugs bzhin du mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por 'gal lo //
translated: But since mental factors sometimes occur in greater and lesser number, they contradict the equivalent immediately preceding state, unlike form.

original: rigs gzhan la ni yod kyi zhes bya ba la rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa rigs gzhan du 'gyur ba rnams ni sems 'ga' zhig la 'byung ba dang mi 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: rigs gzhan la ni yod kyi zhes bya ba la rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa rigs gzhan du 'gyur ba rnams ni sems 'ga' zhig la 'byung ba dang mi 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: They exist in other types means that investigation, analysis and so on exist in some minds and do not exist in other minds since they are different types.

original: 'dir ni gzugs bzhin du rang gi rigs la chos mang ba dang nyung du 'byung ba med do zhes brjod do ;
analyzed: 'dir ni gzugs bzhin du rang gi rigs la chos mang ba dang nyung du 'byung ba med do zhes brjod do ;
translated: But here, unlike form, there is no occurrence of many or few phenomena in its type.

original: /'di ltar tshor ba'i rdzas gcig gi mjug thogs su tshor ba'i rdzas gnyis sam tshor ba gnyis kyi mjug thogs su gcig 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: /'di ltar tshor ba'i rdzas gcig gi mjug thogs su tshor ba'i rdzas gnyis sam tshor ba gnyis kyi mjug thogs su gcig 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, two substances of feeling would not arise immediately after one substance of feeling, nor would one arise immediately after two.

original: de ltar na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rdzas nges par 'byung bas 'dir gzugs dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rdzas nges par 'byung bas 'dir gzugs dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Thus, since mind and mental factors arise as substances, the consequence that they are like form does not apply here.

original: @305b yang ci rang gi rigs kho na'i zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen mi mnyam pa mi 'dod pas 'dri pa'o //
analyzed: @305b yang ci rang gi rigs kho na'i zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen mi mnyam pa mi 'dod pas 'dri pa'o //
translated: Also, does only its own type arise? This is asked because it is not accepted that the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is unequal.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la 'dir ni gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la yang gzugs ltar ches mang ba dang nyung du 'byung ba ma yin nam zhes gang smras pa de la bsal bar bya ba'i phyir tshor
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la 'dir ni gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la yang gzugs ltar ches mang ba dang nyung du 'byung ba ma yin nam zhes gang smras pa de la bsal bar bya ba'i phyir tshor
translated: That is not so, it is said in detail. Here, it is said that the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is unequal, since many or few arise from others‚Äô minds and mental factors, like form. In order to eliminate that, it is said:üîΩFeeling and so on arise from the four primary elements.

original: ba la sogs pa rdzas nyung du las zhes bya ba rgyas par byung ba de tsam zhig brjod kyi rang gi rigs kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa rdzas nyung du las zhes bya ba rgyas par byung ba de tsam zhig brjod kyi rang gi rigs kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom a small amount of substance such as milk‚Äù is not stated to indicate that only a homogeneous state is an immediately preceding condition.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa mtha' dag kho na tshogs pa gzhan mtha' dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //üîΩrgyud 'dra ba dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa mtha' dag kho na tshogs pa gzhan mtha' dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen no // rgyud 'dra ba dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, the entire collection is the immediately preceding condition for the entire collection.

original: 'di dag la rgyud 'dra bas tha snyad 'dogs pa yod pas na /
analyzed: 'di dag la rgyud 'dra bas tha snyad 'dogs pa yod pas na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsimilar continua‚Äù is applied to those that have a similar continuum.

original: de dag ni rgyud 'dra ba dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni rgyud 'dra ba dag go //
translated: Those that have a similar continuum are similar continua.

original: gal te 'dra ba kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin na /
translated: If only a similar state is an immediately preceding condition,

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can du 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can du 'byung zhe na /
translated: how does a afflicted state arise from a non-afflicted state?

original: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen a non-afflicted state‚Äù is applied to those that have a similar continuum.

original: 'di ltar rigs gzhan gyis bar ma chod pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs gzhan gyis bar ma chod pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod kyi /
translated: Thus, the immediately preceding condition is not asserted to be similar to that which is interrupted by another type.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rang gi rigs kyis mchod pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyis mchod pa'o //
translated: It is the immediately preceding condition of its own type.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni de nyid la dpe rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni de nyid la dpe rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: For example, this is an extensive example.

original: de skad du ni mi brjod do zhes bya ba la bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / rig pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de skad du ni mi brjod do zhes bya ba la bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / rig pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: This is not said, because it contradicts the treatise and contradicts reasoning.

original: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena that are similar and immediately preceding to the mind?

original: sems gang gi mjug thogs su de las gzhan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba dag ces rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems gang gi mjug thogs su de las gzhan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba dag ces rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The mind that arises immediately after that mind and mental factors that are different from that mind and mental factors.

original: zag pa med pa'i sems mi 'byung bar thal ba'i phyir na rig pa dang yang 'gal lo //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems mi 'byung bar thal ba'i phyir na rig pa dang yang 'gal lo //
translated: It also contradicts reasoning, because it would follow that uncontaminated minds would not arise.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i snga rol du byung ba'i chos zag pa med pa ni 'ga' yang med de sngar lam ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i snga rol du byung ba'i chos zag pa med pa ni 'ga' yang med de sngar lam ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There are no uncontaminated phenomena that arise prior to perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering because the path is not generated earlier.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rigs gzhan dang mtshungs pas mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du 'dod pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rigs gzhan dang mtshungs pas mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du 'dod pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang mtshungs pas so //
translated: Because they are similar to other types such as feeling, they are asserted to be the immediately preceding condition.

original: de'i phyir 'di bsam par bya ste /üîΩkhams gsum pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams cig car @306a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di bsam par bya ste / khams gsum pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams cig car @306a * //
translated: Therefore, this should be considered:

original: mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because those possessing the three realms manifest simultaneously.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i skad cig skad cig la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i chos kyi thob pa'i mjug thogs su 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa dang zag pa med pa'i thob pa rnams mngon du 'gyur te gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i skad cig skad cig la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i chos kyi thob pa'i mjug thogs su 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa dang zag pa med pa'i thob pa rnams mngon du 'gyur te gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod
translated: In the moment of freedom from attachment to the desire realm, the obtainment of desire realm phenomena manifests immediately after, and then the obtainment of desire realm, formless realm, and uncontaminated states manifests.

original: pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one possesses the afflictions of the form and formless realms.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i 'phags pa la yang khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos kyi thob pa mngon du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i 'phags pa la yang khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos kyi thob pa mngon du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: So too, the obtainment of the three realms' afflictions and uncontaminated states manifest in ƒÅryas who are not free from attachment to the desire realm and who have obtained the meditative attainment of the form and formless realms.

original: de bzhin du khams gsum dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i dge ba rnams dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi thob pa rnams kyang cig car mngon du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams gsum dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i dge ba rnams dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi thob pa rnams kyang cig car mngon du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: So too, the obtainment of the three realms' virtuous minds that are concomitant and not concomitant with the mental faculty and the obtainment of obscured neutral minds manifest simultaneously.

original: 'dis ni skye ba la sogs pa rnams cig car mngon du 'gyur ba yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni skye ba la sogs pa rnams cig car mngon du 'gyur ba yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains that birth and so on manifest simultaneously.

original: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa thob pa dang yongs su nyams pa dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //üîΩskyes pa rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag ces bshad pa 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa thob pa dang yongs su nyams pa dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o // skyes pa rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag ces bshad pa 'dri ba ni /
translated: So too, the obtainment of an arhat and the degeneration of an arhat should be described in accordance with this principle.üîΩThe question arises:

original: ci'i phyir ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is it called future?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus 'chol ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus 'chol ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the future is confused, he says, because there is no prior or subsequent.

original: snga phyir 'byung ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pas da ltar ba snga ba dang / da ltar bas 'das pa snga bar 'dod par nus na ma 'ongs pa la ni de ltar snga phyi yod pa ma yin te dus snga phyi dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga phyir 'byung ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pas da ltar ba snga ba dang / da ltar bas 'das pa snga bar 'dod par nus na ma 'ongs pa la ni de ltar snga phyi yod pa ma yin te dus snga phyi dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the future were prior to the present, and the present were prior to the past, then the future could be asserted to be prior to the present, and the present to the past, because they would be related to prior and subsequent occurrence. But the future does not exist in this way as prior or subsequent, because it is not related to prior or subsequent time.

original: de nyid gyi phyir da ltar ba da ltar ba'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa zhes mi bya ste dus mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid gyi phyir da ltar ba da ltar ba'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa zhes mi bya ste dus mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For this very reason, the present is not called the equivalent immediately preceding condition of the present, because they are simultaneous.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩgal te ma 'ongs pa'i dus la snga phyi med na'o //
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / gal te ma 'ongs pa'i dus la snga phyi med na'o //
translated: Well then, how could the Lord have said,üîΩif the future does not have prior or subsequent?

original: 'das pas da ltar la'am /
analyzed: 'das pas da ltar la'am /
translated: The past is to the present,

original: 'das pa dang da ltar ba dag la rjes su dpog pa ni 'das pa dang / da ltar gyi las rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar ba dag la rjes su dpog pa ni 'das pa dang / da ltar gyi las rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: Inference in regard to the past and present is inference from the past and present.

original: rnam par smin pa ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúits karmic maturation is such and such‚Äù is the karmic maturation result.

original: chos las skyes zhes bya ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: chos las skyes zhes bya ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit generates a dharma that is similar to itself‚Äù is the result that is a similar.

original: de lta na bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta na bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the BhagavƒÅn, etc.

original: gal te 'das pas da ltar ba la dpog go zhes bya bar @306b 'dod na'o //
analyzed: gal te 'das pas da ltar ba la dpog go zhes bya bar @306b 'dod na'o //
translated: If you maintain that the present is inferred from the past.üîΩOthers say: The BhagavƒÅn directly perceives the future result of a karma of that type without relying on the past.

original: gzhan dag na re bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar 'di la sngon gyi mtha' la mi ltos bar de'i rigs can gyi las kyi 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa mngon sum gyis gzigs pa las ma 'ongs pa che ge mo zhig gi mjug thogs su 'di kho na 'byung
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar 'di la sngon gyi mtha' la mi ltos bar de'i rigs can gyi las kyi 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa mngon sum gyis gzigs pa las ma 'ongs pa che ge mo zhig gi mjug thogs su 'di kho na 'byung
translated: From that, he ascertains that such and such a future state arises immediately after this present state.

original: bar 'gyur ro snyam du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar sems can gyi rgyud dag las 'das pa'i las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba rab tu mkhyen pa yin te /
analyzed: bar 'gyur ro snyam du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar sems can gyi rgyud dag las 'das pa'i las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba rab tu mkhyen pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the BhagavƒÅn thoroughly knows the connection between past karma and its result in the continuum of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir nyes pa 'di med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa 'di med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, this fault does not exist.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags su gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i mtshan mar gyur pa dang rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ste rtags mtshan du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags su gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i mtshan mar gyur pa dang rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ste rtags mtshan du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The expression ‚Äúsign of the effect‚Äù means ‚Äúcause of the effect‚Äù or ‚Äúreason of the effect.‚Äù

original: de ni de'i gzugs brnyan lta bu zhig ste /
analyzed: de ni de'i gzugs brnyan lta bu zhig ste /
translated: This is like a reflection.

original: de la gzigs nas bsam gtan dang mngon par mkhyen pa mngon du ma mdzad bzhin du ma 'ongs pa mkhyen pa yin gyi mngon sum du mdzad pas mngon sum du gzigs pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la gzigs nas bsam gtan dang mngon par mkhyen pa mngon du ma mdzad bzhin du ma 'ongs pa mkhyen pa yin gyi mngon sum du mdzad pas mngon sum du gzigs pa ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Having seen this, the Buddha knows the future without realizing the absorptions and the clear knowledges. He does not see the future by direct perception, for he does not realize the absorptions and the clear knowledges.

original: gzhan dag na re de las gong du ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags su gyur pa zhig mngon sum du gzigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de las gong du ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu'i rtags su gyur pa zhig mngon sum du gzigs so zhe na /
translated: According to other masters, the Buddha sees the sign of the effect in the future, but not the effect itself.

original: rtags su gyur pa cung zad kyang med par mngon sum du gzigs nas lung du ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: rtags su gyur pa cung zad kyang med par mngon sum du gzigs nas lung du ston par mdzad do //
translated: The Buddha makes a prediction without knowing the effect even through a sign.

original: gal te de'i 'bras bu bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon sum du gzigs pa ci'i phyir mtshan ma la ltos par byed /üîΩ'on te skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i 'bras bu bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon sum du gzigs pa ci'i phyir mtshan ma la ltos par byed /üîΩ'on te skye'o zhe na /
translated: If the Buddha sees the effect of an action by direct perception, why does he need to rely on a sign?üîΩIf the Buddha sees the effect in the future, why does he not see the action itself?

original: las yongs su ma bzung bas 'dir mtshan ma la ltos pa de lta na yang de'i 'bras bu 'phen pa'i rtags su gyur pa nyid las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: las yongs su ma bzung bas 'dir mtshan ma la ltos pa de lta na yang de'i 'bras bu 'phen pa'i rtags su gyur pa nyid las mi 'da'o //
translated: Because he does not grasp karma, he does not rely on signs here, but he does not go beyond the sign that is the cause of projecting its effect.

original: mngon sum du ma mdzad bzhan  du yang zhes sngar yang bshad do //
analyzed: mngon sum du ma mdzad bzhan  du yang zhes sngar yang bshad do //
translated: It was explained above that he does not perceive it, but he does not not perceive it.

original: gang gi phyir rab tu grags pas sngon dang mtha' mi 'brang ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rab tu grags pas sngon dang mtha' mi 'brang ngo //
translated: Because it is well known, he does not follow the past and future.

original: mkhyen pa de ni du ba las me ltar rjes su dpag pa las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: mkhyen pa de ni du ba las me ltar rjes su dpag pa las byung ba yin te /
translated: That knowledge arises from inference, like fire from smoke.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa mngon sum nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa mngon sum nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise from direct perception, because the connection between cause and effect is not directly perceived.

original: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa la mi bltos pa kho nar 'das pa mkhyen pa de bzhin du 'das pa la mi bltos par yang ma 'ongs pa mkhyen pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ma 'ongs pa la mi bltos pa kho nar 'das pa mkhyen pa de bzhin du 'das pa la mi bltos par yang ma 'ongs pa mkhyen pa yin no //
translated: Just as he knows the past without relying on the future, he knows the future without relying on the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i go rims nges pa med na bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhed pa tsam gyis ma 'ongs pa che ge mo zhig gi mjug thogs su ma 'ongs pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba mkhyen na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i go rims nges pa med na bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhed pa tsam gyis ma 'ongs pa che ge mo zhig gi mjug thogs su ma 'ongs pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba mkhyen na /
translated: If there were no fixed order of future states, then the Bhagavan would know that this future state will arise immediately after that future state, merely by his wish to do so.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa yin zhes te /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa @307a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa yin zhes te / gzugs la sogs pa @307a * //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavan would be omniscient.

original: yul da ltar ba rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa dag gis nyams su ma bstan bar yid kyi rnam par shes pas mkhyen pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yul da ltar ba rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa dag gis nyams su ma bstan bar yid kyi rnam par shes pas mkhyen pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But he does not know future states that are not present, such as form and so on.

original: 'di'i lan du sangs rgyas rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi yul ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di'i lan du sangs rgyas rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi yul ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to this, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe Buddha knows the order of all states of the three times through his knowledge of all things.‚Äù

original: ma 'ongs pa'i go rims nges par gnas pa med na zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i go rims nges par gnas pa med na zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: If there were no fixed order of future states, then the Bhagavan would know that this future state will arise immediately after that future state, merely by his wish to do so.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni nges par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni nges par gnas pa yin no //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is fixed.

original: ci'i phyir chos kyi mchog gi mjug thogs su zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir chos kyi mchog gi mjug thogs su zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Why does the root text say, ‚ÄúImmediately after the supreme mundane state‚Äù?

original: skye ba nges pa'i rgyu ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin na /
analyzed: skye ba nges pa'i rgyu ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin na /
translated: The cause of certain generation is the equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na med pas nges pa med par skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na med pas nges pa med par skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But since that does not exist in the future, it follows that generation would be uncertain.

original: gang zhig gang la rag las te skye ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la rag las te skye ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is generated in dependence on this‚Äù is explained in the Abhidharmakosa as follows:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba ni chos kyi mchog la rag las pa yin gyi gzhan la rag las pa'am bzlog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye ba ni chos kyi mchog la rag las pa yin gyi gzhan la rag las pa'am bzlog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The generation of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is dependent on the supreme mundane state, but not vice versa.

original: de'i phyir chos kyi mchog gi mjug thogs su sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa kho na skye'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi mchog gi mjug thogs su sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa kho na skye'i /
translated: Therefore perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises immediately after the supreme mundane state,

original: chos gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: but not from other states.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to other states.üîΩIf there is no equivalent immediately preceding condition, by what is it generated in dependence?

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med na de la rag las ba gang gis byas she na nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med na de la rag las ba gang gis byas she na nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is generated in dependence on a different potency.

original: de lta ma yin na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med pa'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa rnams kyi go rims nges pa med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med pa'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa rnams kyi go rims nges pa med par 'gyur na /
translated: Otherwise, since there would be no immediately preceding condition, there would be no fixed order in the sequence of seeds, etc.

original: sa bon la sogs pa rnams la go rims nges pa mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa rnams la go rims nges pa mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: But we do see a fixed order in the sequence of seeds, etc.

original: de'i phyir nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir gang zhig skye ba gang la rag las pa kho na de'i mjug thogs su skye'i gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir gang zhig skye ba gang la rag las pa kho na de'i mjug thogs su skye'i gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the difference in their power, that which arises in dependence on a particular seed, etc. arises immediately after that seed, etc. and not after something else.

original: mjug thogs kyi shes pa yod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: mjug thogs kyi shes pa yod kyang rung ste /
translated: Even if the subsequent cognition exists,

original: rten gyi dngos por khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten gyi dngos por khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is no difference in the nature of the support.

original: dper na mig skyes pa na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por gnas pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na mig skyes pa na mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi dngos por gnas pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, when the eye is born, it exists as the nature of the support of eye consciousness.

original: gal te rgyu gzhan mtshang bas mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye na der mig gis ci nyes /
analyzed: gal te rgyu gzhan mtshang bas mig gi rnam par shes pa mi skye na der mig gis ci nyes /
translated: If eye consciousness does not arise due to the absence of other causes, what does the eye do?

original: rgyu ma tshang ba ni dgra bcom pa la yang srid kyi las dang nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba ni dgra bcom pa la yang srid kyi las dang nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: Even for an arhat, the incompleteness of causes is possible, but karma and afflictions do not exist.

original: byed pas rab tu phye ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu bskyed pas rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: byed pas rab tu phye ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu bskyed pas rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: That distinguished by activity is distinguished by generating an effect.

original: yid ltar gnas pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid ltar gnas pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not distinguished by merely abiding like the mind.

original: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma @307b thag pa de skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i chos gang 'bras bur gzung ba de ni thams cad zhes rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma @307b thag pa de skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i chos gang 'bras bur gzung ba de ni thams cad zhes rgyas par smos so //
translated: In order to prove that, he says, ‚ÄúAll that is grasped as an effect of any phenomenon that is about to arise and is similar and immediately antecedent to that is called the similar and immediately antecedent condition.‚Äù

original: dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma dag gis ni 'bras bu gzung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba tha ma dag gis ni 'bras bu gzung ba ma yin te /
translated: The final mind and mental factors of an arhat are not grasped as an effect.

original: de'i phyir de dag skyes bu'i byed pa med pa yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag skyes bu'i byed pa med pa yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because they are devoid of the activity of a person, they are not the similar and immediately antecedent condition.

original: gang dag la sems mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du yod pa de dag ni sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can no //
analyzed: gang dag la sems mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du yod pa de dag ni sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can no //
translated: Those that exist as the similar and immediately antecedent condition of the mind are those that possess the similar and immediately antecedent condition of the mind.

original: skad cig gzhan gyis bar ma chod pa'i phyir ni /
analyzed: skad cig gzhan gyis bar ma chod pa'i phyir ni /
translated: Because they are not obstructed by another moment,

original: sems kyi de ma thag pa can no //
analyzed: sems kyi de ma thag pa can no //
translated: they possess the similar and immediately antecedent condition of the mind.

original: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las so //
analyzed: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las so //
translated: From the meditative attainment that is not mind means from the meditative attainment of cessation and the meditative attainment of nonperception.

original: ldang ba'i sems zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ldang ba'i sems zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind that arises from meditative attainment is a subsequent state of mind.

original: de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems yin pas sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin gyi /üîΩsems kyi de ma thag pa can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems yin pas sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin gyi / sems kyi de ma thag pa can ni ma yin te /
translated: The mind that arises from meditative attainment is a subsequent state of mind because the mind that enters meditative attainment is its equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma rnams kyi sa bar du gcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma rnams kyi sa bar du gcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a subsequent state of mind because the mind that arises from meditative attainment is obstructed by the meditative attainment.

original: snyoms 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa dag kyang snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang pos chod pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can ma yin la /üîΩsems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ni yin te /
analyzed: snyoms 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa dag kyang snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang pos chod pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can ma yin la / sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ni yin te /
translated: The second moment of meditative attainment is not a subsequent state of mind because it is obstructed by the first moment of meditative attainment.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a subsequent state of mind equivalent to the mind because it is the equivalent immediately preceding condition of the mind that enters meditative attainment.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The first moment of meditative attainment is the first moment of meditative attainment.

original: sems de ni skye ba la sogs pa dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin pas de dag sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ma yin la /üîΩsems kyi de ma thag pa can ni yin te /
analyzed: sems de ni skye ba la sogs pa dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin pas de dag sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ma yin la / sems kyi de ma thag pa can ni yin te /
translated: Because that mind is not the equivalent immediately preceding condition of birth and so on, they are not equivalent immediately preceding minds.

original: skad cig ma gzhan gyis bar ma chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gzhan gyis bar ma chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But they are equivalent immediately preceding conditions of mind because they are not obstructed by other moments.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po ste /üîΩde ni sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yang yin la ;
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po ste / de ni sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yang yin la ;
translated: The first moment of meditative attainment is the first moment of meditative attainment.üîΩIt is an equivalent immediately preceding mind and

original: sems kyi de ma thag pa can yang yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi de ma thag pa can yang yin no //
translated: it is an equivalent immediately preceding condition of mind.

original: sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs dag tu ni skad cig ma snga ma snga mas bar ma chod pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can nyid do //
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs dag tu ni skad cig ma snga ma snga mas bar ma chod pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can nyid do //
translated: In states that possess mind, it is an equivalent immediately preceding condition of mind because it is not obstructed by earlier moments.

original: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not the equivalent immediately preceding condition of mind,

original: sems kyi ni de ma thag pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyi ni de ma thag pa nyid do //
translated: it is the immediately preceding condition of mind.

original: @308a * // gnyis pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: @308a * // gnyis pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The second and so on are the third and fourth meditative attainments.üîΩThe first and second meditative attainments are the third and fourth meditative attainments.üîΩThe third and fourth meditative attainments are the first and second meditative attainments.

original: 'di dag gi skye ba la sogs pa dag ni /
analyzed: 'di dag gi skye ba la sogs pa dag ni /
translated: The first and second meditative attainments are the third and fourth meditative attainments.

original: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The first moment of meditative attainment and the state of possessing mind are the third alternative.üîΩThe second moment of meditative attainment and so on are the fourth alternative.

original: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin la /üîΩskad cig ma gzhan gyis chod pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can yin la / skad cig ma gzhan gyis chod pa'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can ma yin no //
translated: The first moment of meditative attainment and the state of possessing mind are the third alternative.üîΩThe second moment of meditative attainment and so on are the fourth alternative.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni dang po dang gnyis pa yin pa dag go //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni dang po dang gnyis pa yin pa dag go //
translated: The first and second meditative attainments are the third and fourth meditative attainments.üîΩThe third and fourth meditative attainments are the first and second meditative attainments.üîΩThe first and second meditative attainments are the third and fourth meditative attainments.

original: dang po dang gnyis pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag yin par bshad do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dang po dang gnyis pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag yin par bshad do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The third and fourth meditative attainments are the first and second meditative attainments.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po dang / sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs de ni der mu gsum pa yin la 'dir ni dang po ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po dang / sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs de ni der mu gsum pa yin la 'dir ni dang po ste /
translated: The first moment of meditative attainment and the state of possessing mind are the third alternative.üîΩThe second moment of meditative attainment and so on are the fourth alternative.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir sems kyi mtshungs pa na de ma thag pa can yin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir sems kyi mtshungs pa na de ma thag pa can yin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can ni ma yin te /
translated: It is concomitant with the mind because it is generated by the immediately preceding condition of the mind, but it is not concomitant with meditative attainment because it is generated by the immediately preceding condition of the mind.üîΩ

original: de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig las gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is generated by the equivalent immediately preceding condition, it is equivalent immediately preceding, but it is not equivalent immediately preceding of meditative attainment because the equivalent immediately preceding condition of meditative attainment is different from the moment of meditative attainment.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa dang / ldang ba'i sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa ni der mu bzhi pa yin la 'dir ni gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa dang / ldang ba'i sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa ni der mu bzhi pa yin la 'dir ni gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second moment of meditative attainment and so on and the arising of the mind of emergence are the second possibility here, because they are equivalent immediately preceding of meditative attainment but not equivalent immediately preceding of mind.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang chod pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang chod pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because meditative attainment is not obstructed.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can yin la /üîΩsems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can yin la / sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can ma yin no //
translated: They are equivalent immediately preceding of meditative attainment,üîΩbut not equivalent immediately preceding of mind.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems ni de dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems ni de dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: The mind of meditative attainment is not the equivalent immediately preceding condition of those two.

original: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i sems dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa dag ni der mu dang po yin la 'dir ni mu gsum pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro // sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i sems dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa dag ni der mu dang po yin la 'dir ni mu gsum pa ste /
translated: because they are not natures that are equivalent immediately preceding conditions of mind.

original: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can dang / snyoms par 'jug pa de ma thag pa can yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can dang / snyoms par 'jug pa de ma thag pa can yin no //
translated: The mind that arises from the meditative attainment of non-perception and the second moment of meditative attainment and so on are the first possibility here, because they are equivalent immediately preceding conditions of mind and equivalent immediately preceding conditions of meditative attainment.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po dang / sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyi skye ba la sogs pa der mu gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po dang / sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyi skye ba la sogs pa der mu gnyis pa yin te /
translated: The first moment of meditative attainment and birth and so on in the context of minds that possess minds are the second possibility,

original: chos de dag ni sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma snga ma med pa'i @308b phyir sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: chos de dag ni sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa can gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma snga ma med pa'i @308b phyir sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yang ma yin la /
translated: because those phenomena are not equivalent immediately preceding conditions of mind and equivalent immediately preceding conditions of meditative attainment do not exist in the first moment of meditative attainment and birth and so on.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can yang ma yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa can yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it concomitant with the attainment of meditative equipoise.

original: da ni ji ltar ldang ba'i sems yun ring mo zhig tu chod pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar ldang ba'i sems yun ring mo zhig tu chod pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Now, how is it that the mind of emergence is interrupted for a long time?

original: de'i phyir sems gzhan gyis ma chod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems gzhan gyis ma chod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause it is not interrupted by another mind.‚Äù

original: sems kyi bar gcod par byed pa ni sems yin gyi ldan pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi bar gcod par byed pa ni sems yin gyi ldan pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is explained that mind is what interrupts the mind, not non-associated formative factors.

original: 'dir ni mu gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni mu gsum pa yin no //
translated: Here, there are three possibilities.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po dang / sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyi skye ba la sogs pa ni der mu gcig pa yin la 'dir ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma dang po dang / sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kyi skye ba la sogs pa ni der mu gcig pa yin la 'dir ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The first moment of meditative equipoise and birth, etc. in a state with mind are one possibility there, but here it is the fourth.

original: sems gzhan gyis bar ma chod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems gzhan gyis bar ma chod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is not interrupted by another mind.

original: sems kyi bar du gcod par byed pa ni sems yin gyi ldan pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi bar du gcod par byed pa ni sems yin gyi ldan pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is explained that mind is what interrupts the mind, not non-associated formative factors.

original: de'i phyir ldang ba'i sems ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldang ba'i sems ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the mind that arises is called the equivalent immediately preceding condition of the mind that enters meditative attainment.

original: 'dir ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i rgyun gyi ldang ba'i sems rnams kyang brjod par bya ste 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i rgyun gyi ldang ba'i sems rnams kyang brjod par bya ste 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the minds that arise from the continuum of meditative attainment are also described because they have the same result.

original: rim pas skye ba la byas pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: rim pas skye ba la byas pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of the phrase ‚Äúarises in a series‚Äù?

original: gang la gzhol ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems de sngar skye ste /
analyzed: gang la gzhol ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems de sngar skye ste /
translated: The mind that enters meditative attainment arises first, because it is the basis of meditative attainment.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems la gzhol ba de yang de nyid kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag tu skye'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems la gzhol ba de yang de nyid kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag tu skye'o //
translated: That mind that enters meditative attainment arises in the second moment that is equivalent and immediately preceding it.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa de yang snyoms par 'jug pa'i rgyun gyi rim pa nges pa ci zhig byas she na /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de yang snyoms par 'jug pa'i rgyun gyi rim pa nges pa ci zhig byas she na /
translated: What is the purpose of the phrase ‚Äúthe meditative attainment that arises in a series‚Äù?

original: nges pa de la dgos pa med pa'i phyir cig car mi skye'o //
analyzed: nges pa de la dgos pa med pa'i phyir cig car mi skye'o //
translated: It is not generated simultaneously because it has no purpose.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig cig car skyes pa rnams gang gcig gis mi nus pas de la dgos pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig cig car skyes pa rnams gang gcig gis mi nus pas de la dgos pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that one moment of meditative attainment that arises simultaneously is unable to generate another moment of meditative attainment.

original: de'i phyir sngon gyi 'du byed kyi dbang gis dus skal ba rnams su yang snyoms par 'jug pa'i rgyun skye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon gyi 'du byed kyi dbang gis dus skal ba rnams su yang snyoms par 'jug pa'i rgyun skye'o //
translated: Therefore, the continuum of meditative attainment arises in various time periods due to the power of prior formative forces.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma de lta bu rnams kyang snga ma dang phyi ma'i nges pas rgyur brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i skad cig ma de lta bu rnams kyang snga ma dang phyi ma'i nges pas rgyur brjod par bya'o //
translated: Also, those moments of meditative attainment should be called causes by the rule of prior and subsequent.

original: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad do //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad do // zhes bya ba la /
translated: All phenomena are objects.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul las gzhan pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul las gzhan pa'i chos ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: With regard to this, there are no phenomena that are objects of minds and mental factors.

original: thams cad dmigs pa yin gyi thams cad ni thams cad kyi ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ci rigs par zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩde nyid bstan @309a * //
analyzed: thams cad dmigs pa yin gyi thams cad ni thams cad kyi ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ci rigs par zhes bya ba smos so // de nyid bstan @309a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas is fitting‚Äù is stated to show that all are objects but not all are objects of all.

original: par bya ba'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i ni gzugs so zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: par bya ba'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i ni gzugs so zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says: Form is the object of eye consciousness and so on.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de ni yul gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de ni yul gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it has that nature. It has the nature of an object.

original: skye mched dang rdzas dang ; skad cig nges pas zhes bya ba 'byung ste /üîΩde la skye mched nges pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa ni gzugs kyi skye mched yin la /
analyzed: skye mched dang rdzas dang ; skad cig nges pas zhes bya ba 'byung ste / de la skye mched nges pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa ni gzugs kyi skye mched yin la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the determination of the sense-sphere, substance, and moment‚Äù is supplied.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'o //üîΩrdzas nges pa ni gzugs sngon po 'dzin par byed pa'i dmigs pa ni de kho na yin la ;
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'o // rdzas nges pa ni gzugs sngon po 'dzin par byed pa'i dmigs pa ni de kho na yin la ;
translated: Among these, the determination of the sense-sphere is that the object of eye consciousness together with its associated elements is the sense-sphere of visible form, and not the other sense-spheres.

original: ser po la sogs pa ma yin no //üîΩskad cig ma nges pa ni skad cig ma gang zhig gang gi dmigs pa yin pa de kho na de'i dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: ser po la sogs pa ma yin no // skad cig ma nges pa ni skad cig ma gang zhig gang gi dmigs pa yin pa de kho na de'i dmigs pa yin la /
translated: The determination of substance is that the object of the consciousness that apprehends blue is just that, and not yellow, etc.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: The determination of the moment is that the object of a particular moment is just that, and not another moment.

original: bdag nyid ji lta bar zhes bya ba la gang gi dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta bar zhes bya ba la gang gi dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as it is in reality. That is, the object of a particular consciousness is just that, and not something else.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang sgra la sogs pa dag la de dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang sgra la sogs pa dag la de dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
translated: The consciousnesses of the ear, etc., should be understood in the same way with respect to sound, etc.

original: smras pa de bzhin te zhes bya ba 'di ni de ltar yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: smras pa de bzhin te zhes bya ba 'di ni de ltar yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúSo it is.‚Äù This means: ‚ÄúIt is just as you have said.‚Äù

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rten can kho na yin gyi gzhan gyi rten can ma yin no //üîΩ'di'i rdzas su nges pa yang skye mched nges pa ltar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rten can kho na yin gyi gzhan gyi rten can ma yin no // 'di'i rdzas su nges pa yang skye mched nges pa ltar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The visual consciousness is supported by the eye alone and not by any other sense-faculty.üîΩThe eye is its substantial cause, just as the sense-faculty is the cause of the sense-faculty itself.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The auditory consciousness, etc., should be understood in the same way.

original: skyes pa rnams ni rten dang lhan cig nges pa dag yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa rnams ni rten dang lhan cig nges pa dag yin te /
translated: The consciousnesses that have already arisen are determined in relation to their support,

original: de skye ba rten med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye ba rten med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not occur without a support.

original: 'das pa rnams kyang rten dang lhan cig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni rten gang dag dang lhan cig skyes nas 'gags pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'das pa rnams kyang rten dang lhan cig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni rten gang dag dang lhan cig skyes nas 'gags pa rnams te /
translated: The past consciousnesses are also determined in relation to their support, because they have already arisen in association with a support.

original: gzhan du 'das pa'i mig brten pa dang bcas par bzhag tu med do //
analyzed: gzhan du 'das pa'i mig brten pa dang bcas par bzhag tu med do //
translated: But it is not possible to posit the past eye sense faculty as supported.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: dpe ston pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rkyen gang yin pa ni de'i dmigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dpe ston pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rkyen gang yin pa ni de'i dmigs pa ma yin la /
translated: The object condition of the eye consciousness is not its object.

original: dmigs pa gang yin pa yang dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa gang yin pa yang dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: And the object is not the object condition.
