original: gang gi phyir gzugs sngar skyes pa rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa la rkyen no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs sngar skyes pa rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa la rkyen no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because past forms that have already arisen are conditions for the arising of eye consciousness.

original: de yang gzugs yod pa'i dus su rnam par shes pa'i phyir de dmigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de yang gzugs yod pa'i dus su rnam par shes pa'i phyir de dmigs pa ma yin la /
translated: And because consciousness exists when form exists, it is not its object.

original: ji ltar rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de gzugs rnams ma bsdus pas @309b mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yod pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de gzugs rnams ma bsdus pas @309b mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yod pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because the consciousness that exists is not included in forms, it follows that the object of eye consciousness does not exist.

original: ma yin te mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mnyam pa'i yul da ltar ba yul yin pa'i phyir da ltar ba med par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ma yin te mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mnyam pa'i yul da ltar ba yul yin pa'i phyir da ltar ba med par mi rung ngo //
translated: That is not so, because it is not possible for the present object to be the object of eye consciousness that exists simultaneously with it.

original: gang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i 'dus byas la dmigs pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen 'das pa med par khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir med pa ma yin te rkyen du 'gyur bar 'os so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i 'dus byas la dmigs pa de'i phyir rnam par shes pa de'i dmigs pa'i rkyen 'das pa med par khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir med pa ma yin te rkyen du 'gyur bar 'os so zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it focuses on past and future conditioned states, it is not nonexistent, since it is not accepted that the past object-field of that consciousness does not exist, but it is suitable to be a condition.

original: dpe ston pa rnams na re /
analyzed: dpe ston pa rnams na re /
translated: ƒÄbhidharmikas say:

original: chos mngon pa ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: The object-field of consciousness is not the object-field condition,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa nyid las tha dad pa ma yin pas bya ba gzhan gsum la byed pa med de da ltar ba'i dmigs pa la bya ba med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa nyid las tha dad pa ma yin pas bya ba gzhan gsum la byed pa med de da ltar ba'i dmigs pa la bya ba med do //
translated: because it is not different from the nature of consciousness itself. It does not function in the other three actions, because it does not function in the present.

original: gang 'di skye mched kyi rdzas kyi mtshan nyid nges pas dmigs pa nges par 'dod na der mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'di skye mched kyi rdzas kyi mtshan nyid nges pas dmigs pa nges par 'dod na der mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that the object-field is definite because the substance of the sense bases is definite, that is not so,

original: dmigs pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cause for the object-field.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin pa'i tshe rnam par shes pa grub pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen da ltar bas bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin pa'i tshe rnam par shes pa grub pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i rkyen da ltar bas bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because consciousness is established even when there is no objective condition.

original: bya ba med na ji ltar rkyen du 'gyur zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bya ba med na ji ltar rkyen du 'gyur zhes zer ro //
translated: If there is no function, how can there be a condition?

original: yang 'di la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de kho na nyid mkhyen pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi de kho na nyid mkhyen pa ci zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of reality of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, with regard to this?

original: rnam par dpyad pa 'di la ni brjod par bya ba mang du 'byung bas zhar las byung bas chog go //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa 'di la ni brjod par bya ba mang du 'byung bas zhar las byung bas chog go //
translated: Since there is much to be said in this analysis, let us stop this digression.

original: byed rgyu zhes bya ba bdag por bshad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: byed rgyu zhes bya ba bdag por bshad ces bya ba la /
translated: The efficient cause is called the dominant condition.

original: 'dis ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa'i chos thams cad ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa'i chos thams cad ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This shows that all factors, with the exception of the factor itself, are the dominant condition.

original: rkyen 'di ni rgyu dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dag pas lhag pa yin pas na bdag po'i rkyen no //
analyzed: rkyen 'di ni rgyu dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dag pas lhag pa yin pas na bdag po'i rkyen no //
translated: This condition is called the dominant condition because it is superior to the other conditions, the causal condition, the homogeneous immediate condition, and the objective condition.

original: 'di ji ltar lhag ce na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar lhag ce na /
translated: How is it superior?

original: rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa'i chos thams cad bdag po'i rkyen yin pa de ltar rgyu dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa'i rkyen dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa'i chos thams cad bdag po'i rkyen yin pa de ltar rgyu dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa'i rkyen dag ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not causes, homogeneous immediate conditions, or objective conditions.

original: chos thams cad yin la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos thams cad yin la zhes bya ba la /
translated: All phenomena are objective conditions.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni chos thams cad yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ba las /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni chos thams cad yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ba las /
translated: The objective condition of mental consciousness is all phenomena.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen yang chos thams cad yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen yang chos thams cad yin te /
translated: All phenomena are objective conditions.

original: de'i phyir gang gis 'di kho na lhag par brjod pa 'di la dmigs pa'i rkyen las phul du byung ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis 'di kho na lhag par brjod pa 'di la dmigs pa'i rkyen las phul du byung ba ci yod ce na /
translated: Therefore, what is the superiority of the objective condition over the dominant condition?

original: phul du byung ba yod de /
analyzed: phul du byung ba yod de /
translated: There is a superiority.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi @310a * //üîΩlhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni nam yang dmigs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi @310a * // lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni nam yang dmigs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Mental factors and mental statesüîΩare never objective conditions.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni yin pas chos thams cad bdag po'i rkyen bzhin du dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni yin pas chos thams cad bdag po'i rkyen bzhin du dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: But they are dominant conditions. Therefore, not all phenomena are objective conditions, as they are dominant conditions.

original: gzhan dag na re chos gang zhig chos gang gi dmigs pa dang dmigs par bya ba ma yin yang de de'i dmigs pa ste yul gyi ngo bos gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re chos gang zhig chos gang gi dmigs pa dang dmigs par bya ba ma yin yang de de'i dmigs pa ste yul gyi ngo bos gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Others say: Although a phenomenon is not the object field and focal object of a phenomenon, it is its focal object because it exists as the object field.

original: de ltar na chos thams cad dmigs pa'i rkyen no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar na chos thams cad dmigs pa'i rkyen no zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus all phenomena are the objective condition of all phenomena.

original: de lta na bdag po mi rung bas de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na bdag po mi rung bas de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because it is illogical that the dominant condition is like that.

original: skye ba la gegs med pa'i ngo bos gnas pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad bdag po'i rkyen no //
analyzed: skye ba la gegs med pa'i ngo bos gnas pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad bdag po'i rkyen no //
translated: All phenomena are the dominant condition because they exist in the aspect of not obstructing the arising of other phenomena.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: thams cad ni de lta ma yin te skye mched kyi dmigs pa rdzas so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ni de lta ma yin te skye mched kyi dmigs pa rdzas so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because the object field of the sense bases is substantially distinct.

original: skye bzhin pa'i bdag po'i rkyen la /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i bdag po'i rkyen la /
translated: The dominant condition of that which is arising

original: gzhan gyi bdag po kho na yin gyi rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bdag po kho na yin gyi rkyen ma yin no //
translated: is only the dominant condition, it is not a condition.

original: de bzhin du dmigs bzhin pa kho na dmigs pa'i rkyen yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs bzhin pa kho na dmigs pa'i rkyen yin la /
translated: Similarly, that which is being observed is only the objective condition.

original: dmigs bzhin pa ma yin pa dmigs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dmigs bzhin pa ma yin pa dmigs pa kho na yin te /
translated: That which is not being observed is only the object field.

original: de bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba dang mi dmigs pa las dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba dang mi dmigs pa las dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, co-arisen states and non-apprehended states are not objective conditions.

original: rkyen 'di ni lhag pa yin pas bdag po'i rkyen no //
analyzed: rkyen 'di ni lhag pa yin pas bdag po'i rkyen no //
translated: Since this condition is predominant, it is called the dominant condition.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: ji ltar rkyen gyi ngo bo rnam pa thams cad pa du mas de ltar gsum rnams la zhes bya bya ba de dag la rkyen gyi ngo bo lhag pas yin te rdzas kyi ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rkyen gyi ngo bo rnam pa thams cad pa du mas de ltar gsum rnams la zhes bya bya ba de dag la rkyen gyi ngo bo lhag pas yin te rdzas kyi ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Since the three conditions are established by many types of essential natures, they are conditions by way of their essential natures, not by way of substance.

original: lhag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With respect to the statement, ‚Äúpredominant,‚Äù etc.

original: thams cad thams cad kyi dmigs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad kyi dmigs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: All do not have all as their object.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi yin gyi rang gi ngo bo'i rang gi ngo bo lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi yin gyi rang gi ngo bo'i rang gi ngo bo lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The objective condition is for all minds and mental factors, but not for their own nature.

original: rkyen gyi mtshan nyid ji skad bshad pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen gyi mtshan nyid ji skad bshad pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristics of a condition as they have been explained are impossible.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi 'dus byas lta bu dang zhes bya ba la bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi 'dus byas lta bu dang zhes bya ba la bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Like an unconditioned state is to a conditioned state, because it is not something to be generated.

original: de la rgyu dang bdag po'i rkyen dag ni rgyu bsdus par bshad zin pas /
analyzed: de la rgyu dang bdag po'i rkyen dag ni rgyu bsdus par bshad zin pas /
translated: The causal condition and the dominant condition have already been explained as being included in the cause.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa'i rkyen dag brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa'i rkyen dag brjod par bya'o //
translated: The similar immediately preceding condition and the objective condition should be mentioned.

original: kha cig ni skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'i phyogs gcig mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu'i phyogs gcig mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: One part of the homogeneous cause and the omnipresent cause is the similar immediately preceding condition.

original: skyes pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par las 'di med pa ni 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par las 'di med pa ni 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because the result is different due to the distinction of the state of arising.

original: gal te yang rgyu thams cad @310b skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang thun mong ba de lta na yang de dag rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin par mi brjod de /
analyzed: gal te yang rgyu thams cad @310b skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang thun mong ba de lta na yang de dag rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin par mi brjod de /
translated: Even though all causes are common to the result of conscious effort, they are not called the result of natural outflow.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang khams la sogs pa tha dad pas 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang khams la sogs pa tha dad pas 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The similar immediately preceding condition is the result of conscious effort because it is similar and dissimilar due to the distinction of virtue, nonvirtue, contaminated, uncontaminated, realm and so on.

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag ni skal ba mnyam pa kho na yin pas de la thun mong pa med do //üîΩde lta na 'o na skyes pa mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu dag ni skal ba mnyam pa kho na yin pas de la thun mong pa med do // de lta na 'o na skyes pa mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Homogeneous and omnipresent causes are homogeneous causes alone, so they do not have a commonality.üîΩIf that is so, then there would be no difference between the result of conscious effort and the result of natural outflow because the causes of similar status and coexistent causes and the mind and mental factors that are similar in type are the immediately preceding condition.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang lhan cig skyes pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang lhan cig skyes pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because the result of conscious effort is different from the result of natural outflow, since the causes of similar status and coexistent causes and the immediately preceding condition are not similar in type.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni bya ba la ltos pa kho na yin pas de dag sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu rnams dmigs so //üîΩmtshungs pa de ma thag par skyes pa 'bras bu la ltos pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni bya ba la ltos pa kho na yin pas de dag sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu rnams dmigs so // mtshungs pa de ma thag par skyes pa 'bras bu la ltos pa ni /
translated: Because the effect of conscious effort is dependent on action alone, it is the observed object condition of those minds and mental factors that are concomitant causes.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ces bya ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ces bya ste /
translated: The effect of the equivalent immediately preceding condition is dependent on the equivalent immediately preceding condition.üîΩThe equivalent immediately preceding condition is the immediately preceding mind and mental factors that have arisen and are ceasing.

original: ji ltar lhan cig skyes pa la 'bras bu'i khyad par 'ga' yang med pas gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag rdzas sam bhe de sya sam bhe da: de bzhin du rgyu dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi yangüîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar lhan cig skyes pa la 'bras bu'i khyad par 'ga' yang med pas gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag rdzas sam bhe de sya sam bhe da: de bzhin du rgyu dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Just as the effect of co-existent causes and the effect of concomitant causes are not distinguished because they are not different from the co-existent cause and the concomitant cause, so too the effect of the equivalent immediately preceding condition is not distinguished from the equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: ji ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi rnam pa gang yin pa de byed rgyu'i rgyu zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa'i rkyen gyi rnam pa gang yin pa de byed rgyu'i rgyu zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say: The aspect of the object of observation is the active cause of the object of observation.

original: rdzas dang 'bras bu thun mong ba las 'bras bu thun mong ba med de /
analyzed: rdzas dang 'bras bu thun mong ba las 'bras bu thun mong ba med de /
translated: The effect of the object of observation is not a common effect of the substance and the effect of the object of observation.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni skyes bu yin pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni skyes bu yin pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object condition is the result of the human action.

original: 'ga' zhig tu byed rgyu'i rgyu yang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bur yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu byed rgyu'i rgyu yang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bur yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the active cause sometimes the result of the human action?

original: yod mod kyi de ni bdag po'i 'bras bu kho na ma yin bsam gtogs pa ste skyes bu byed pa'i 'dras bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod mod kyi de ni bdag po'i 'bras bu kho na ma yin bsam gtogs pa ste skyes bu byed pa'i 'dras bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is, but it is not only the dominant result; it is also the result of the human action.

original: de'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa'i rkyen rgyur bsdus pa mthong ngo //üîΩrgyu gnyis po dag 'gag pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa'i rkyen rgyur bsdus pa mthong ngo // rgyu gnyis po dag 'gag pa la /
translated: Therefore, we see that the similar immediately preceding condition and the object condition are included in the cause.

original: bya ba byed do zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'gag pa kho na la bya ba @311a * //
analyzed: bya ba byed do zhes bya ba la / 'gag pa kho na la bya ba @311a * //
translated: The two causes perform their function in regard to cessation.

original: byed do zhes bya ba nges par gzung ngo //üîΩskye ba'i dbang du byas nas yin gyi /
analyzed: byed do zhes bya ba nges par gzung ngo // skye ba'i dbang du byas nas yin gyi /
translated: The function is performed in regard to cessation alone.üîΩThis is the definite meaning.

original: 'gag pa'i dbang du byas nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i dbang du byas nas ni ma yin te /
translated: This is in terms of arising, not in terms of cessation.

original: byed pa'i dus kho nar 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa'i dus kho nar 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The result occurs at the time of the function.

original: bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The function is threefold.

original: 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang / 'bras bu 'byin pa dang / yul nye bar longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang / 'bras bu 'byin pa dang / yul nye bar longs spyod pa'o //
translated: 1. the result that is grasped, 2. the result that is emitted, and 3. the result that is enjoyed as an object.

original: de gnyis ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'bras bu la bya ba byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnyis ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'bras bu la bya ba byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: These two are the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause.

original: ji ltar de gnyis de la bya ba byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar de gnyis de la bya ba byed ce na /
translated: How do these two perform their function with regard to the result?

original: phan tshun 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang / 'byin par nus pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: phan tshun 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang / 'byin par nus pa nyid kyis te /
translated: They perform their function with regard to the result by grasping and emitting the result that arises simultaneously with them.

original: phan tshun bral bas yul 'dzin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun bral bas yul 'dzin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, if they were separated from each other, it would not be tenable that they grasp the object.

original: gsum po ni skye ba la'o zhes bya ba la /üîΩskye ba kho na la'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: gsum po ni skye ba la'o zhes bya ba la / skye ba kho na la'o zhes bya bar nges par gzung ngo //
translated: The three perform their function with regard to that which is arising.üîΩThe three are the universal cause, the homogeneous cause, and the ripening cause.üîΩThey perform their function with regard to that which is arising, not with regard to that which has arisen.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dag 'phangs pa'i dbang gis skye ba de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa 'di dag gis ni skye bzhin pa la bya ba byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dag 'phangs pa'i dbang gis skye ba de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa 'di dag gis ni skye bzhin pa la bya ba byed do //
translated: Because the result that is projected arises by the power of the projecting cause, these causes, the homogeneous cause and so on, perform their function with regard to that which is arising.

original: re shig skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu gnyis po ni mjug thogs su rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yod pas 'bras bu skye bzhin pa la bya ba byed par 'gyur na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las ni mjug thogs su rnam par smin pa'i
analyzed: re shig skal ba mnyam pa dang kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu gnyis po ni mjug thogs su rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yod pas 'bras bu skye bzhin pa la bya ba byed par 'gyur na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las ni mjug thogs su rnam par smin pa'i
translated: The two causes homogeneous and omnipresent have a result of natural outflow that arises immediately after them, so they function with respect to a result that is in the process of arising.

original: 'bras bu med cing /
analyzed: 'bras bu med cing /
translated: But the result of karmic maturation does not arise immediately after the cause of karmic maturation.

original: 'das pa'i byed pa med pas skye bzhin pa la ji ltar bya ba byed par rung zhe na /
analyzed: 'das pa'i byed pa med pas skye bzhin pa la ji ltar bya ba byed par rung zhe na /
translated: And since past states do not function, how could they function with respect to a result that is in the process of arising?

original: 'dir bya ba'i sgras ni nus pa brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir bya ba'i sgras ni nus pa brjod de /
translated: Here the term function refers to the potency of a cause.üîΩEven though a cause that is separated by many eons has ceased, the result arises due to its power alone.

original: rgyu bskal pa du mas chod par 'gags kyang de'i mthu kho nas thun mong gi rgyu nyid kyi phyir skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i byed pa med kyang 'bras bu 'byin par nus pa la bya ba'i sgras 'dogs so //
analyzed: rgyu bskal pa du mas chod par 'gags kyang de'i mthu kho nas thun mong gi rgyu nyid kyi phyir skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i byed pa med kyang 'bras bu 'byin par nus pa la bya ba'i sgras 'dogs so //
translated: Even though the result does not arise due to the function of the cause, it is designated as functioning because it has the power to generate a result.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni skye ba la bya ba byed de drangs te skabs 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni skye ba la bya ba byed de drangs te skabs 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The condition as equivalent immediately preceding condition functions with respect to that which is arising because it is the condition that draws in and opens a gap for the arising of a result.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni 'gag pa la bya ba byed de /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni 'gag pa la bya ba byed de /
translated: The objective condition is the object-field of the present thought and thoughtconcomitants, because it is the cause of the activity of the present thought and thoughtconcomitants.

original: da ltar gyi sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams kyi yul da ltar ba 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi sems dang / sems las byung ba rnams kyi yul da ltar ba 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The dominant condition is the cause of the activity of the present thought and thoughtconcomitants, because it is the cause of the activity of the present thought and thoughtconcomitants.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni zhes bya ba la 'di'i bya ba ni mi sgrib pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni zhes bya ba la 'di'i bya ba ni mi sgrib pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa yin te /
translated: The activity of the dominant condition is to not obstruct.

original: de ni skye ba dang ; 'gag pa la khyad par med pas de ni gnas skabs thams cad du bya ba byed par brjod do //
analyzed: de ni skye ba dang ; 'gag pa la khyad par med pas de ni gnas skabs thams cad du bya ba byed par brjod do //
translated: Since it is not differentiated in regard to arising and cessation, it is said that it performs its activity in all circumstances.

original: gal te mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag las dmigs pa'i rkyen skye ba bya ba'i dngos por rtogs na /
analyzed: gal te mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag las dmigs pa'i rkyen skye ba bya ba'i dngos por rtogs na /
translated: If the objective condition is understood as the cause of the activity of arising from the associated cause and co-arisen cause,

original: 'o na de dag gi rgyu dang rkyen ci yin pa brjod par bya dgos @311b so zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de dag gi rgyu dang rkyen ci yin pa brjod par bya dgos @311b so zhe na /
translated: then it must be explained what the cause and condition of those are.

original: rgyu las rgyu nyid dang / rkyen las rkyen nyid du byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu las rgyu nyid dang / rkyen las rkyen nyid du byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The cause is not made into a cause from the cause, and the condition is not made into a condition from the condition.

original: gzhan dun ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen nyid 'dod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dun ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen nyid 'dod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the future would not be accepted as a cause and condition.

original: 'o na dngos po skye ba'i rgyu rnams kyi dgos pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po skye ba'i rgyu rnams kyi dgos pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of causes of things?

original: rgyu med par dngos po skye bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med par dngos po skye bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: They think that things do not arise without a cause.

original: bzhi yis sems dang sems byung rnams //
analyzed: bzhi yis sems dang sems byung rnams //
translated: The mind and mental factors arise from four.

original: zhes bya ba la ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni bzhi kho nas yin no zhes nges par gzung bar bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni bzhi kho nas yin no zhes nges par gzung bar bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the verse means that the mind and mental factors arise from four conditions.

original: gzhan dag na re ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni /
translated: Others say:

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu bstan pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu bstan pa'i don du ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù indicates the cause.

original: gang gi phyir sems dang sems las byung ba yin pa de'i phyir bzhi dag gis yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems dang sems las byung ba yin pa de'i phyir bzhi dag gis yin te /
translated: Since the mind and mental factors are the cause, they arise from four conditions.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni gzhan la bya ba mi byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni gzhan la bya ba mi byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: The objective condition does not function for others.

original: de la 'di dag gi rgyu'i rkyen ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la 'di dag gi rgyu'i rkyen ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The causal condition of those is

original: rgyu lnga po thams cad ni thams cad kyi rgyu'i rkyen ma yin te /üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu lnga po thams cad ni thams cad kyi rgyu'i rkyen ma yin te / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: All five causes are not the causal condition of all.üîΩWhat are they?

original: ci rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: ci rigs pa yin no //
translated: They are as follows.

original: gang zhig gang dag gi rgyu'i rkyen yin pa de ni sngar /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dag gi rgyu'i rkyen yin pa de ni sngar /
translated: That which is the causal condition of those is as previously stated:

original: nyon mongs can dang rnam smin skye //
analyzed: nyon mongs can dang rnam smin skye //
translated: ‚ÄúThe afflicted and the arising of karmic maturation.‚Äù

original: lhag dang zhes bya ba rgyas par bshad zin to //
analyzed: lhag dang zhes bya ba rgyas par bshad zin to //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù indicates that the explanation is complete.

original: snga ma zhes bya ba ni phyis skye ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma zhes bya ba ni phyis skye ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúformer‚Äù is stated to exclude the arising of later states.

original: de lta na gzhan dag gis bar du chod pa yang yin par thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na gzhan dag gis bar du chod pa yang yin par thal lo zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that those that are separated by others would also be similar immediately antecedent conditions.

original: gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa rnams so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa rnams so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond, the root text states, ‚ÄúThose that are not separated by others.‚Äù

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gis shes par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gis shes par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that are not separated by others‚Äù should be applied to ‚Äúmind and mental factors.‚Äù

original: de dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni rang gi rigs lngar skyes pas skabs phye ba la rag las te /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni rang gi rigs lngar skyes pas skabs phye ba la rag las te /
translated: The similar immediately antecedent condition of those is dependent on the arising of the five types of its own class that have opened a gap.

original: skyes pa'i snga ma yin zhing de dag la gzhan dag gis bar du ma chod pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa'i snga ma yin zhing de dag la gzhan dag gis bar du ma chod pa yin no //
translated: It is the former of those that have arisen and is not separated from them by others.

original: ci rigs par yul lnga po dag dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci rigs par yul lnga po dag dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five objects are as appropriate.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rkyen ni go rims bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga po dag yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i rkyen ni go rims bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga po dag yin no //
translated: The objective conditions of the eye consciousness and so on, along with their concomitant states, are the five objects such as form and so on, respectively.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'i ni chos thams cad do //
translated: The objective condition of mental consciousness and its concomitant states is all phenomena.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni byed rgyu'i rgyu kho na yin pas rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa'i thams cad do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni byed rgyu'i rgyu kho na yin pas rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa'i thams cad do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The dominant condition is the active cause itself, therefore, it is said to be all phenomena except for its own nature.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag gi dmigs pa'i rkyen ni skye bzhin pa la bya ba med pa'i phyir brjod par mi bya'o //üîΩrkyen @312a * //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag gi dmigs pa'i rkyen ni skye bzhin pa la bya ba med pa'i phyir brjod par mi bya'o // rkyen @312a * //
translated: The objective condition of coemergent and concomitant causes is not mentioned because they do not function in relation to that which is arising.

original: bzhi rnams kyis skye bar byed de rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu lnga po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bzhi rnams kyis skye bar byed de rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu lnga po rnams kyi'o //
translated: The four conditions generate. The causal condition is the five causes.

original: de dang bral na de dag skye ba dang de dag skye ba'i bya ba dang skye bzhin pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang bral na de dag skye ba dang de dag skye ba'i bya ba dang skye bzhin pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If they are separated from those, they do not arise, the action of arising does not exist and that which is arising also does not exist.

original: de'i rgyu can la de dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can la de dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is the cause of that is the object of that.

original: gang zhig gang gi dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa de ni nam du yang de'i dmigs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no //üîΩgsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa de ni nam du yang de'i dmigs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no // gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: That which is the cause of the object of a certain consciousness is never not the cause of the object of that consciousness.üîΩThe two meditative attainments are due to three.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúdue to three‚Äù is to be supplied.üîΩThe cause of the meditative attainment of nonperception is the meditative attainment of nonperception itself, because it is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause of that.

original: gsum kho nas zhes bya bar nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: gsum kho nas zhes bya bar nges par gzung ngo //
translated: The cause of the meditative attainment of cessation is the meditative attainment of cessation itself, because it is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause of that.üîΩThe cause of the meditative attainment of nonperception is the meditative attainment of nonperception itself, because it is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause of that.üîΩThe cause of the meditative attainment of cessation is the meditative attainment of cessation itself, because it is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause of that.üîΩThe cause of the meditative attainment of nonperception is the meditative attainment of nonperception itself, because it is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause of that.üîΩThe cause of the meditative attainment of cessation is the meditative attainment of cessation itself, because it is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause of that.üîΩThe cause of the meditative attainment of nonperception is the meditative attainment of nonperception itself, because it is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause of that.üîΩThe cause of the meditative attainment of cessation is the meditative attainment of cessation itself, because it is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause of that.üîΩThe cause of the meditative attainment of nonperception is the meditative attainment of nonperception itself, because it is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause of that.üîΩThe cause of the meditative attainment of cessation is the meditative attainment of cessation itself, because it is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause of that.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen med pa la rgyu smras pa ni de dag ni dmigs par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen med pa la rgyu smras pa ni de dag ni dmigs par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause of the meditative attainment of nonperception is the meditative attainment of nonperception itself, because it is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause of that.üîΩThe cause of the meditative attainment of cessation is the meditative attainment of cessation itself, because it is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause of that.üîΩThe cause of the meditative attainment of nonperception is the meditative attainment of nonperception itself, because it is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause of that.

original: rgyu'i rkyen ni rnam pa lnga bshad na 'di gnyis ni rnam par smin pa dang / kun 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen ni rnam pa lnga bshad na 'di gnyis ni rnam par smin pa dang / kun 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The cause of the meditative attainment of cessation is the meditative attainment of cessation itself, because it is the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause of that.

original: de gnyis kyi rgyu'i rkyen ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩsa mtshungs pa'i zhes bya ba 'byung ste /

analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni lhan cig skyes pa rnams phan tshun te /

analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa dus @315a * //

analyzed: mnyam du skyes pa dag las gang yang rung ba zhig ji ltar rjes su mthun par byed ce na /

analyzed: myu gu dang grib ma bzhin nam /

analyzed: mar me dang snang ba bzhin no // de ltar na de dag ni zhes bya brgyas par 'byung ba la /

analyzed: 'byung ba dag las skyes pa'i phyir skye ba'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: Thus, they are the generative cause, because they are the cause of the generation of the derivative form.

analyzed: rten du 'gyur ba'i phyir rten pa'i rgyu nyid do //

analyzed: rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: They are the transformative cause, because they are the cause of the transformation of the derivative form.

analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gnas pa'i rgyu nyid do //

original: rgyu gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rgyu gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: These five types of cause are only the active cause, because the other causes are not tenable.

analyzed: /'byung ba rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni ma yin no //

analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect is distinct.

analyzed: 'byung ba'i rnam pa 'dra bas sems kyi nye ba'i mtshan nyid ltar ma yin no //

analyzed: gal te 'bras bu gcig pa nyid ma yin yang phan tshun 'bras bu nyid kyis lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid do zhe na /

analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /

analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa 'bras bu ma yin pa de lta na yang de dag gi yod pa ni de las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa gzhan te /

analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa dag gi 'bras bu gcig pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: nye ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa phan tshun 'bras bu dang lhan cig sems phan tshun 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / nye ba'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa dang lhan cig 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa dag gcig ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa dag gcig ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The primary elements and the derivative form are not a single cause.

original: 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'o //
translated: The primary elements are not the co-arisen cause of derivative form.

original: gzhan yang 'byung ba las gyur pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'byung ba las gyur pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin la /
translated: Moreover, derivative form is virtuous and nonvirtuous,

original: 'byung ba rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: but the primary elements are neutral.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni @315b de lta bu mtshan nyid can ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni @315b de lta bu mtshan nyid can ma yin no //
translated: The co-arisen cause does not have that characteristic.

original: lung du ma bstan pa yang med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yang med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the neutral would not exist,üîΩbecause the primary elements are not the co-arisen cause of derivative form.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang rigs mi mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang rigs mi mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not of the same type, being either virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi 'byung ba las gyur pa ni 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rgyur byas nas yin par yang 'dod de /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi 'byung ba las gyur pa ni 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rgyur byas nas yin par yang 'dod de /
translated: They also assert that future and present secondary characteristics are derived from the primary elements that are their cause.

original: de bzhin du kha cig 'byung ba rnams dang mi ldan yang 'byung ba las gyur pa dang ldan pa yin na lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos nyid ni de ltar ma yin pas 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin no //üîΩmtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du kha cig 'byung ba rnams dang mi ldan yang 'byung ba las gyur pa dang ldan pa yin na lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos nyid ni de ltar ma yin pas 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin no // mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yang ma yin te /
translated: Some say: Even though they do not possess the primary elements, they possess that derived from the primary elements, but coemergent phenomena are not like that. Therefore the primary elements are not coemergent causes of that derived from the primary elements.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not homogeneous causes because they are not by nature mind or mental factors.

original: kun tu 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag kyang ma yin te ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag kyang ma yin te ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not omnipresent causes or causes of karmic maturation because they are unobscured neutral states.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not conascent causes because they are not of the same continuum.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir la dus phyis skyes pa dang yang mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir la dus phyis skyes pa dang yang mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are coemergent and because they do not resemble those arising later.

original: gal te lung du ma bstan pa dang skal ba ma nyam pa yang rigs gzhan nyid kyi phyir tshor ba dang sems bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lung du ma bstan pa dang skal ba ma nyam pa yang rigs gzhan nyid kyi phyir tshor ba dang sems bzhin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are not homogeneous because they are neutral, like feeling and mind,

original: rigs gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs gzhan nyid kyang ma yin te 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they are not of different types because they have the same result.

original: 'byung gyur rnam gsum phan tshun du //üîΩzhes bya ba ni ci rigs par ro //
analyzed: 'byung gyur rnam gsum phan tshun du // zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par ro //
translated: The three from primary elements are each other‚Äôs.üîΩThe three from primary elements are each other‚Äôs homogeneous cause, according to the rule.

original: lus dang ngag gi las sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa srog gcod pa nas tshig bkyal pa spong ba'i bar 'chal pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa bdun spong ba ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa srog gcod pa nas tshig bkyal pa spong ba'i bar 'chal pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa bdun spong ba ste /
translated: Physical and verbal karma that is concomitant with the mind is the seven abandonments from abandoning taking life to abandoning idle speech, which are subsumed by the absorptions and uncontaminated vows.

original: spong ba bdun po 'di dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: spong ba bdun po 'di dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: These seven abandonments are each other‚Äôs coemergent cause.

original: sngar byung ba thams cad skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sngar byung ba thams cad skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: All that arises earlier is the homogeneous cause of that which arises later.

original: dge ba dge ba'i yin pa nas lung du ma bstan pa lung du ma bstan pa'i bar gyi yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dge ba'i yin pa nas lung du ma bstan pa lung du ma bstan pa'i bar gyi yin no //
translated: Virtue is the domain of virtue, up to neutral is the domain of neutral.üîΩSince it is expanded, there are twenty.

original: rgyas par byas na nyi shu yin pas mdor bsdu na sems bcu gnyis so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyas par byas na nyi shu yin pas mdor bsdu na sems bcu gnyis so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since it is summarized, there are twelve minds.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: Other than that means except for that.

original: dge ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //üîΩbsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o // bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: Virtue is concomitant with nonattachment and so on.üîΩObscured neutral is concomitant with the afflicted view of the self and extreme view.

original: mi dge ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye bar nyon mongs pa lhag ma dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //üîΩde dag las gzhan pa ma @316a * //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye bar nyon mongs pa lhag ma dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o // de dag las gzhan pa ma @316a * //
translated: Nonvirtue is concomitant with the remaining afflictions and branch afflictions.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Other than those is unobscured neutral.

original: gzugs kyi khams na mi dge ba med de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na mi dge ba med de /
translated: Nonvirtue does not exist in the form realm.

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir bsgribs pa kho na yin gyi mi dge ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir bsgribs pa kho na yin gyi mi dge ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They are only obscured, not nonvirtuous, because they are not karmic maturation of the afflictions and branch afflictions.

original: de'i phyir de dag dang mtshungs par ldan par sems thams cad bsgribs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag dang mtshungs par ldan par sems thams cad bsgribs pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore all minds concomitant with them are only obscured.

original: slob pa'i zag pa med pa ni slob pa'i sems so //
analyzed: slob pa'i zag pa med pa ni slob pa'i sems so //
translated: The uncontaminated mind of a learner is the mind of a learner.

original: mi slob pa'i ni mi slob pa'i sems so //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i ni mi slob pa'i sems so //
translated: The uncontaminated mind of a nonlearner is the mind of a nonlearner.

analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe dge ba dang zhes bya ba 'byung ba la /
translated: When entering meditative attainment, virtuous minds arise.

original: dge ba gang gi mjug thogs su dge ba gang dang gang sa gang gis bsdus pas 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba gang gi mjug thogs su dge ba gang dang gang sa gang gis bsdus pas 'byung zhe na /

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su sbyor ba las byung ba kho na yin gyi skyes nas thob pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su sbyor ba las byung ba kho na yin gyi skyes nas thob pa ni ma yin te /

analyzed: 'dir skyes pas mngon du byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: kha cig na re ni mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa kho na 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re bsam gtan dang po'i yang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It also arises in the first absorption.

original: gzhan dag na re ni bsam gtan khyad par can gyi yang ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni bsam gtan khyad par can gyi yang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It also arises in the special first absorption.

analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni mnyam par ma bzhag par thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa ltar sas bar du chod pa 'dren par mi nus so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is not able to draw forth the absorptions that are separated by levels, like the alternating meditative attainment of alternating dhyana.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgrib pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgrib pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Obscuration at the time of linking is

analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir na skyes nas thob pa'i dge ba'i mjug thogs su bsgribs pa yin gyi //
translated: because birth existence is afflicted by all afflictions, it is obscured immediately after virtuous minds obtained from birth.

analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag mngon du 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi rang gi sa pa'i sems la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not that the obscured neutral minds of the form and formless realms are manifest because they depend on the minds of their own level.üîΩThe formless realm is distant from the desire realm in terms of object field, aspect, support and preparation.

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /üîΩde la rten ring ba nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste / de la rten ring ba nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: The formless realm is distant from the desire realm in terms of support because

analyzed: ji ltar gzugs su gtogs pa'i rten gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa'i sems mngon du byed pa ltar /
translated: just as the support of the form realm manifests the emanating mind of the desire realm,

analyzed: gzugs med par gtogs pa'i rten gyis 'dod par gtogs pa'i chos mngon du mi byed pa'o //

original: de la rnam pa ring bas ring ba nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa ring bas ring ba nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: The formless realm is distant from the desire realm in terms of aspect because

analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa @316b na spyod pa'i rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu rnam par byed pa ltar gzugs med pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa'i khams rnam par mi byed pa'o //
translated: just as the desire realm is distinguished by the aspects of grossness and so on, the formless realm does not distinguish the desire realm.üîΩThe formless realm is distant from the desire realm in terms of preparation becauseüîΩjust as the desire realm is prepared by the form realm, the formless realm does not prepare the desire realm.

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa ring ba nyid kyis kyang ring ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also distant due to the distance of its object-field.

original: gzugs med pa'i dge ba dngos gzhi zag pa dang bcas pa'i rten gyi spyod yul yin pas /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i dge ba dngos gzhi zag pa dang bcas pa'i rten gyi spyod yul yin pas /
translated: The formless realm is the object-field of the wholesome of the formless realm and of the fundamental meditative attainment of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas kyi skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rgyu dang / 'di gzugs kyi khams su yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas kyi skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rgyu dang / 'di gzugs kyi khams su yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs med pa dag 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po yang ma yin te /
translated: The formless realm is not the antidote of the realm of desire, just as it is not the antidote of the realm of fine-materiality.

analyzed: de ltar na gnyen po ring ba nyid kyis kyang ring ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is also distant due to the distance of its antidote.üîΩThe wholesome of the realm of desire can arise immediately after the wholesome of the realm of fine-materiality and of the formless realm, and also after the unobscured-non-defined of the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe wholesome of the realm of desire can arise immediately after the wholesome of the realm of desire, of the realm of fine-materiality and of the formless realm, and also after the obscured-non-defined and the unobscured-non-defined of the realm of desire.

analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The unobscured-non-defined of the realm of desire can arise immediately after the wholesome and the unobscured-non-defined of the realm of desire, and also after the unobscured-non-defined of the realm of fine-materiality.üîΩThe unobscured-non-defined of the realm of fine-materiality can arise immediately after the wholesome and the unobscured-non-defined of the realm of fine-materiality, and also after the unobscured-non-defined of the formless realm.üîΩThe unobscured-non-defined of the formless realm can arise immediately after the wholesome and the unobscured-non-defined of the formless realm.üîΩThe obscured-non-defined of the realm of desire can arise immediately after the wholesome and the obscured-non-defined of the realm of desire.üîΩThe obscured-non-defined of the realm of

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sems thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sems thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: All minds of the form and formless realms.

original: sa gong ma'i sems rnam pa drug gis 'chi 'pho ba la 'dod pa'i khams su nying mtshams sbyor ba bzlog tu med do //
analyzed: sa gong ma'i sems rnam pa drug gis 'chi 'pho ba la 'dod pa'i khams su nying mtshams sbyor ba bzlog tu med do //
translated: Death and rebirth-linking in the desire realm is not averted by any of the six types of higher realm minds.

original: zag pa med pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa mngon du 'gyur ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa mngon du 'gyur ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that afflicted states manifest immediately after a uncontaminated mind.

original: de la sa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la sa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four levels of the desire realm.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa'i mjug thogs su sa gong ma pa'i mngon du byed pa med la /
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa'i mjug thogs su sa gong ma pa'i mngon du byed pa med la /
translated: Afflicted states of a higher level do not manifest immediately after afflicted states of a lower level.

original: zag pa med pa yang mngon du mi byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa yang mngon du mi byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that a uncontaminated state does not manifest.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i dge ba la zhes bya la /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i dge ba la zhes bya la /
translated: A virtuous mind of the form realm arises immediately after a virtuous mind of the form realm.

original: sprul pa'i sems ni bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems ni bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu ste /
translated: The emanating mind is the result of absorption.

original: de ni bsam gtan la ma zhugs par mngon du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan la ma zhugs par mngon du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible to manifest that mind without entering absorption.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis 'chi ba'i tshe gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu nying mtshams sbyor ba bzlog tu med la /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis 'chi ba'i tshe gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu nying mtshams sbyor ba bzlog tu med la /
translated: When dying with an unobscured neutral mind, it is impossible to be conceived in the form and formless realms.

original: gdon mi za bar bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu'i mjug thogs su yang bsam gtan la 'jug par bya dgos pas ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can kho na'o //

translated: Since one definitely enters meditative attainment of the absorptions immediately after the result of the absorptions, after an unobscured neutral mind, two virtuous and afflicted minds that occur in the form realm and an afflicted mind that occurs in the formless realm arise.

original: gzugs na dge las bcu gcig @317a * //üîΩgo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs na dge las bcu gcig @317a * // go zhes bya ba la /
translated: Eleven from virtue in the form realm.

original: rang gi sa pa gsum dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bzhi ste /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa gsum dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bzhi ste /
translated: Three of its own level and four of the desire realm arise from virtue of the form realm.
