translated: When entering meditative attainment, it arises from a virtuous mind of the formless realm.üîΩWhen linking at death, it arises from an obscured mind.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
translated: When entering meditative attainment, it arises from a learner mind and from an unlearner mind.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Except for a unobscured neutral mind of the formless realm.

original: rnam par smin pa'i sems ni rang gi sa pa'i sems la rag las pa'i phyir de ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sems ni rang gi sa pa'i sems la rag las pa'i phyir de ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for that, it arises from a mind of its level, because a maturational mind depends on a mind of its level.

original: de ni dgu'i mjug thogs su zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni dgu'i mjug thogs su zhes bya ba la /
translated: It arises from nine.

original: rang gi sa pa gsum dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa gnyis te snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe dge ba dang / sprul pa'i sems dang ldang ba'i tshe gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir ba sa 'og ma pa la brten pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can dang /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa gsum dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa gnyis te snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe dge ba dang / sprul pa'i sems dang ldang ba'i tshe gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir ba sa 'og ma pa la brten pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can dang /
translated: The three of its own level and the two of the desire realm level, since they arise from the virtuous mind of meditative equipoise and the virtuous mind of the formless realm level arises from the emanating mind and the mind of change of level.

original: ldang ba'i tshe slob pa dang mi slob pa las so //
analyzed: ldang ba'i tshe slob pa dang mi slob pa las so //
translated: The afflicted mind arises from the learner and nonlearner minds at the time of rising from meditative attainment.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The two afflicted minds of the desire realm level arise from the three of its own level and the two of the desire realm level.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems ni bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi sbyor ba ma yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems ni bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi sbyor ba ma yin la /
translated: An afflicted mind is not the preparation of the absorptions and formless realm meditative attainments.

original: dge ba'i sems kyi nying mtshams sbyor ba la yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems kyi nying mtshams sbyor ba la yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor does it link with a virtuous mind.

original: de ltar na gsum po 'di dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gsum po 'di dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, except for these three.

original: bsgribs pa brgyad las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsgribs pa brgyad las zhes bya ba la /
translated: Eight obscured minds arise from the obscured mind.

original: rang gi sa pa gsum dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe gzugs med pa na spyod pa gsum las so //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa gsum dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe gzugs med pa na spyod pa gsum las so //
translated: Three of its own level, and when linking at death, the virtuous mind and the unobscured neutral mind of the desire realm, and when linking at death, the three of the formless realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la gzugs kyi khams su nying mtshams sbyor ba med la /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang zhes bya ba la 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la gzugs kyi khams su nying mtshams sbyor ba med la /
translated: Two afflicted minds of the desire realm. One who is not free from attachment to the desire realm does not link with the form realm.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i sems kyis 'chi 'pho yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir bzhi po 'di dag ma gtogs so //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i sems kyis 'chi 'pho yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir bzhi po 'di dag ma gtogs so //
translated: And it is not the case that death occurs through the learner or nonlearner minds. Therefore, except for these four,

original: de las drug rang gi sa pa gsum dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang / @317b nyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir ba'i tshe dge ba'o //
analyzed: de las drug rang gi sa pa gsum dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang / @317b nyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir ba'i tshe dge ba'o //
translated: Six arise from that afflicted mind of the desire realm. Three of its own level, and when linking at death, the two afflicted minds of lower levels and the virtuous mind when oppressed by afflicted meditative attainment.

original: gang gi tshe sbyor ba'i sems ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sbyor ba'i sems ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: When the mind of preparation is not present, it is not obscured neutral.

original: de'i phyir de'i mjug thogs su slob pa dang mi slob pa dang / gzugs med pa'i dge ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i mjug thogs su slob pa dang mi slob pa dang / gzugs med pa'i dge ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, neither learner nor nonlearner nor formless realm virtue arises from it.

original: 'og ma las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la ni sa gong mar skye ba yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'og ma las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la ni sa gong mar skye ba yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, one who is not free from attachment to the lower level does not take birth in a higher level.

original: de'i phyir de'i mjug thogs su gzugs med par gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa can mi 'byung ngo //üîΩsa gzhan gyis ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i mjug thogs su gzugs med par gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa can mi 'byung ngo // sa gzhan gyis ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, afflicted formless realm states do not arise from it.

original: de ni skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa na de'i mjug thogs su mi srid do //
analyzed: de ni skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa na de'i mjug thogs su mi srid do //
translated: Also, it is not unobscured neutral since it is impossible for it to arise from that state at birth or entry to meditative attainment.

original: ma bsgribs pa ni gsum las so //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩde ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems su mi rung zhing /
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa ni gsum las so // zhes bya ba la / de ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems su mi rung zhing /
translated: The three arise from unobscured.üîΩIt is not suitable as the mind of entry to rebirth.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sbyor ba las byung ba ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi sbyor ba las byung ba ma yin la /
translated: It is not derived from preparation in the desire realm.

original: slob ba dang mi slob pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ldang ba'i sems kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: slob ba dang mi slob pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ldang ba'i sems kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the mind of emergence from meditative attainment that is learner, nonlearner, or formless realm.

original: de'i phyir rang gi sa pa gsum las yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi sa pa gsum las yin no //
translated: Therefore it arises from three of its own realm.

original: de las drug ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las drug ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Six arise from that.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dag dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can dag dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: At the time of linking, afflicted minds of the desire realm and formless realm arise from it.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i phyir slob pa dang mi slob pa gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i dag kyang de las mi 'byung la /
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i phyir slob pa dang mi slob pa gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i dag kyang de las mi 'byung la /
translated: Since it is derived from preparation, virtuous minds derived from preparation of the formless realm and learner and nonlearner minds do not arise from it.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pas gzir bar mi byed pas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba yang de'i mjug thogs su mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pas gzir bar mi byed pas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba yang de'i mjug thogs su mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Since it is not afflicted and it is not suppressed by unobscured neutral states, virtuous minds of the desire realm do not arise from it.

original: skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa ni sa gong ma dang 'og ma pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yang de'i mjug thogs su mi srid do //
analyzed: skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa ni sa gong ma dang 'og ma pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yang de'i mjug thogs su mi srid do //
translated: Also, it is impossible for birth and meditative attainment of the higher and lower realms to arise from it.

original: gzugs med pa'ang de'i tshul lo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'ang de'i tshul lo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The formless realm is similar to that.

original: de'i skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe sa 'og ma pa'i dge ba la sogs pa rnams las srid pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe sa 'og ma pa'i dge ba la sogs pa rnams las srid pa ma yin la /
translated: When it arises and enters meditative attainment, it does not arise from virtue and so on of lower levels.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa dag gi mjug thogs su yang ma yin te /
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa dag gi mjug thogs su yang ma yin te /
translated: It also does not arise from the end of learner and nonlearner minds.

original: de'i phyir rang gi sa pa gsum kho na las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi sa pa gsum kho na las 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore it arises from three of its own level.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: From afflicted minds of lower level

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams rnams so //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams rnams so //
translated: means when linking at death, it arises from afflicted minds of the desire realm and form realm.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems las ni sems dgu ste /üîΩrang gi sa pa gsum dang / ldang ba'i tshe gzugs su @318a * //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems las ni sems dgu ste / rang gi sa pa gsum dang / ldang ba'i tshe gzugs su @318a * //
translated: From a virtuous mind of the formless realm, nine minds arise.

original: gtogs pa'i dge ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: gtogs pa'i dge ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
translated: Three of its own level, a virtuous mind of the form realm when rising from meditative attainment, afflicted minds of lower levels when linking at death, and learner and nonlearner minds when entering meditative attainment.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang / 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang / 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Except for virtue of the desire realm and unobscured neutral states of the desire and form realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la gzugs med pa'i khams bskal pa yin pas de'i sa pa'i dge ba'i ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ldang ba'i sems kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la gzugs med pa'i khams bskal pa yin pas de'i sa pa'i dge ba'i ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ldang ba'i sems kyang ma yin te /
translated: The formless realm is a long distance from the desire realm, therefore the mind of withdrawal belonging to the formless realm is not the virtue of that level.

original: des na de'i mjug thogs su mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na de'i mjug thogs su mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is not logical that it arises after that.

original: ji ltar 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa'i sems gzugs na spyod pa'i sbyor bas thob par bya ba yin pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa'i sems gzugs na spyod pa'i sbyor bas thob par bya ba yin pa ltar /
translated: Just as a mind of emanation belonging to the desire realm is obtained by the preparation of the form realm,

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa gzugs med pa'i sbyor bas thob par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa gzugs med pa'i sbyor bas thob par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: unobscured neutral states of the desire and form realms are not obtained by the preparation of the formless realm.

original: de'i phyir de yang ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore they are also excluded.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe na'o //
translated: The virtue of the form realm is when entering meditative attainment.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa dag las so zhes bya ba ni ldang ba'i tshe na'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa dag las so zhes bya ba ni ldang ba'i tshe na'o //
translated: From both learner and nonlearner minds.

original: bsgribs pa las bdun zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: bsgribs pa las bdun zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: From the obscured, seven.üîΩWhen rising from afflicted meditative attainment, a form realm virtuous mind and the two afflicted desire realm minds arise from afflicted meditative attainment.üîΩFrom the obscured mind of the two higher realms, seven minds arise.üîΩFrom the desire realm obscured mind, seven minds arise.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir ba sa 'og ma la bstan pa'i phyir gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgribs pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir ba sa 'og ma la bstan pa'i phyir gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgribs pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis so //
translated: From the form realm obscured mind, six minds arise.

original: de de bzhin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de de bzhin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: From the formless realm obscured mind, only the formless realm obscured mind arises.üîΩFrom the desire realm virtuous mind, six minds arise.üîΩFrom the form realm virtuous mind, seven minds arise.üîΩFrom the formless realm virtuous mind, five minds arise.üîΩFrom the desire realm unobscured neutral mind, six minds arise.üîΩFrom the form realm unobscured neutral mind, seven minds arise.üîΩFrom the formless realm unobscured neutral mind, four minds arise.üîΩFrom the desire realm afflicted mind, four minds arise.üîΩFrom the form realm afflicted mind, three minds arise.üîΩFrom the formless realm afflicted mind, two minds arise.üîΩFrom the desire realm mind of emanation, two minds arise.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams dang zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'di ltar sa 'og ma la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la gzugs med pa'i khams su nying mtshams sbyor ba med la /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can rnams dang zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'di ltar sa 'og ma la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la gzugs med pa'i khams su nying mtshams sbyor ba med la /
translated: From the form realm mind of emanation, three minds arise.üîΩFrom the formless realm mind of emanation, one mind arises.üîΩFrom the desire realm mind governing demeanor, four minds arise.üîΩFrom the form realm mind governing demeanor, five minds arise.üîΩFrom the formless realm mind governing demeanor, two minds arise.üîΩFrom the desire realm mind governing creativity, four minds arise.üîΩFrom the form realm mind governing creativity, five minds arise.üîΩFrom the formless realm mind governing creativity, two minds arise.üîΩFrom the desire realm mind of actual basis, six minds arise.üîΩFrom the form realm mind of actual basis, seven minds arise.üîΩFrom the formless realm mind of actual basis, four minds arise.üîΩFrom the desire realm mind of emanation, two minds arise.üîΩFrom the form realm mind of emanation, three minds arise.üîΩFrom the formless realm mind of emanation, one mind arises.üîΩFrom the desire realm mind governing demeanor, four minds arise.üîΩFrom the form realm mind governing demeanor, five minds arise.üîΩFrom the formless realm mind governing demeanor, two minds arise.üîΩFrom the desire realm mind governing creativity, four minds arise.üîΩFrom the form realm mind governing creativity, five minds arise.üîΩFrom the formless realm mind governing creativity, two minds arise.üîΩFrom the desire realm

original: des slob pa'am mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba yang ma yin pas de ni lnga las mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des slob pa'am mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba yang ma yin pas de ni lnga las mi 'byung ngo //
translated: It does not arise from five because it does not arise from the formless realm and it does not arise from the learner or nonlearner absorptions.üîΩIt arises from two, the desire realm and form realm, when linking.

original: de ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe na 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe na 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag las 'byung ngo //
translated: It arises from the virtuous minds of the three realms.

original: khams gsum pa'i dge ba dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i dge ba dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams so //
translated: The virtuous minds of the three realms are virtuous minds of the desire realm, form realm and formless realm.

original: dge ba smos pa ni gzhan bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba smos pa ni gzhan bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term virtuous is stated to exclude others.

original: slob pa las so zhes bya ba ni rgyun tu gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob pa las so zhes bya ba ni rgyun tu gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It arises from the learner mind because it is concomitant with the mindstream.

original: @318b slob pa ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems ma yin la /
analyzed: @318b slob pa ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems ma yin la /
translated: The learner mind is not the mind of linking.

original: dge ba sbyor ba las byung ba yin pas gzhan gyi mjug thogs su ma byung ngo //
analyzed: dge ba sbyor ba las byung ba yin pas gzhan gyi mjug thogs su ma byung ngo //
translated: It does not arise from the minds of others because it is derived from the preparation of virtuous minds.

original: de las lnga zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las lnga zhes bya ba la /
translated: Five arise from it.

original: ldang ba'i tshe khams gsum pa'i dge ba rnams dang / rgyun tu gtogs pa'i slob pa dang / rdo rje lta bu'i mjug thogs su mi slob pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: ldang ba'i tshe khams gsum pa'i dge ba rnams dang / rgyun tu gtogs pa'i slob pa dang / rdo rje lta bu'i mjug thogs su mi slob pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: When entering meditative attainment, it is the learner mind that is obtained and the mind of no more learning that arises after vajra like concentration.üîΩFrom those five just explained.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i lnga po de dag nyid las so zhes bya ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe ni khams gsum pa'i dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i lnga po de dag nyid las so zhes bya ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe ni khams gsum pa'i dge ba rnams so //
translated: When entering meditative attainment, it is the virtuous minds of the three realms.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i mjug thogs su ni slob pa las so //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i mjug thogs su ni slob pa las so //
translated: When arising from vajra like concentration, it is the learner mind.

original: zad pa shes pa'i mjug thogs su ni mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa'i mjug thogs su ni mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: When arising from the knowledge of elimination, it is the knowledge of nonarising.

original: de las sems ni bzhi po dag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las sems ni bzhi po dag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: From that, the mind is four.

original: ldang ba'i tshe na khams gsum pa'i dge ba rnams dang / mi slob pa ste /
analyzed: ldang ba'i tshe na khams gsum pa'i dge ba rnams dang / mi slob pa ste /
translated: When rising from meditative attainment, it is the virtuous minds of the three realms and the mind of no more learning.

original: dper na zad pa shes pa las mi skye ba shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na zad pa shes pa las mi skye ba shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the knowledge of nonarising arising from the knowledge of elimination.

original: mi slob pa'i mjug thogs su slob pa ni nam yang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i mjug thogs su slob pa ni nam yang mi 'byung ste /
translated: The learner mind never arises after the mind of no more learning.

original: nyon mongs ma pa can gyi sems kyis bar chod pa'i phyir te nyon mongs pa kun tu spyod pa med par ni yongs su nyams pa med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs ma pa can gyi sems kyis bar chod pa'i phyir te nyon mongs pa kun tu spyod pa med par ni yongs su nyams pa med do //
translated: because the wholesome of the realm of desire is interrupted by the defiled thought of the realm of desire.

original: skyes nas thob pa dang sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa dang sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The wholesome of the realm of desire is of two types: acquired by birth and arisen from the exercise of effort.

original: de la sbyor ba las byung ba ni gang sbyor bas 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba las byung ba ni gang sbyor bas 'thob pa ste /
translated: That which is acquired by birth is not lost through retrogressing.

original: de ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa las byung ba'o //
translated: That which arises from the exercise of effort is of three types: arisen from hearing, from reflection, from cultivation.

original: de la mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams na bsgom pa las byung ba med do //
analyzed: de la mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams na bsgom pa las byung ba med do //
translated: It is not arisen from cultivation in the realm of desire, because the realm of desire is not concentrated.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni bsam pa las byung ba med de /üîΩgzhan de dag ni rgyud zhi gnas kyis brlan pa'i phyir sems na ting nge 'dzin nyid nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni bsam pa las byung ba med de / gzhan de dag ni rgyud zhi gnas kyis brlan pa'i phyir sems na ting nge 'dzin nyid nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not arisen from reflection in the realm of fine-materiality, because the realm of fine-materiality is not distracted.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni bsgom pa las byung ba kho na ste gzhan med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni bsgom pa las byung ba kho na ste gzhan med do //
translated: In the realm of immateriality, it is only arisen from cultivation, because the other two types of wholesome thought are absent there.

original: skyes nas thob pa'i dge ba ni sems sbyor ba med par skyes pa nyid kyis 'thob pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa'i dge ba ni sems sbyor ba med par skyes pa nyid kyis 'thob pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Virtue obtained from birth is that obtained by merely being born, without any mental preparation.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag tu srid pa bar mar nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag tu srid pa bar mar nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma'o //
translated: It is the moment of linking at birth in the desire realm and form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su ni skye ba srid par gang gi thob pa dang po skye'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su ni skye ba srid par gang gi thob pa dang po skye'o //

analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: The second is the four: arisen from karmic maturation, arisen from deportment, arisen from craftsmanship, and arisen from emanation.

original: 'di ni rgyu dang las kyi dbye bas phye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu dang las kyi dbye bas phye ba yin no //

original: de la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o //üîΩspyod @319a * //
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o // spyod @319a * //
translated: Arisen from the cause of karmic maturation is arisen from karmic maturation.

original: lam las byung ba ni spyod lam pa'o //
analyzed: lam las byung ba ni spyod lam pa'o //

original: de bzhin du bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa las byung ba ni bzo'i gnas pa dang sprul pa pa ste rgyu mtshan gyis bdun par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa las byung ba ni bzo'i gnas pa dang sprul pa pa ste rgyu mtshan gyis bdun par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Arisen from craftsmanship and arisen from emanation are arisen from craftsmanship and emanation because they are explained as the seventh case, the source.

original: yang na de dag la dmigs nas skye ba'i phyir de dag las byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang na de dag la dmigs nas skye ba'i phyir de dag las byung ba'o //
translated: Or else, they arise by taking them as their object, thus they are derived from them.

original: spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa dang / gsum ni las kyi dbye bas phye la /
analyzed: spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa dang / gsum ni las kyi dbye bas phye la /
translated: The three, i.e., the stage of deportment, the stage of skill in the arts, and the stage of emanation, are distinguished by the division of action.

original: snga ma ni rgyu'i dbye bas phye ba yin no //
analyzed: snga ma ni rgyu'i dbye bas phye ba yin no //

original: gzugs na bzo ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs na bzo ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi gzhal med khang la sogs pa thams cad las las skyes pa dang / sprul pa pa yin gyi ;
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi gzhal med khang la sogs pa thams cad las las skyes pa dang / sprul pa pa yin gyi ;
translated: All the palaces, etc. of the realm of form are born from action and are emanations.

original: mkhan bzos byas pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: mkhan bzos byas pa ni cung zad kyang med do //

analyzed: gzugs can rnams la 'gro ba dang 'dug pa la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir spyod lam pa yod do //

analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang sprul pa pa rnams med bsam bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i dbye ba med do //

analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs med pa'i phyir spyod lam pa la sogs pa yang med do ;

analyzed: / gzugs la dmigs pa ni de na med do zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: But it is not to be said that the object of the demeanor mind does not exist there.

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / (dngos po yan lag yongs su bzung ba ting nge 'dzin med /

analyzed: bsgom pa) de'i nam mkha'i nyer bsdogs la de yod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes slob dpon 'dus bzang zer ro //

analyzed: yang ci nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs la gzugs yod pa gang las der thal bar 'gyur bar brjod ce na /

analyzed: de dag la mi srid pa'i phyir der thal ba med do //
translated: It does not follow that it exists there because it is impossible for it to exist there.

analyzed: gang du lung du ma bstan pa'i srid pa de dag gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir dgag pa bya'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu ma yin pa las nus pa med do //

translated: The objects of the arts are also sound.üîΩBecause the one who teaches emanates sound and the one who is taught emanates form, etc., and the one who is taught emanates sound, and the one who is taught emanates form, etc.

translated: It arises immediately after the afflicted state of the form realm because it arises from the state of meditative development of the form realm, from the state of birth in the form realm, from the state of meditative development of the form realm at the time of emerging from meditative attainment, and from the afflicted meditative attainment of the lower stage.

analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pa'o //

analyzed: slob pa las ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs su zad pa shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The learned state arises immediately after the vajra like concentration, like the knowledge of elimination.

original: mi slob pa ni zad pa shes pa'i mjug thogs su mi skye ba shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni zad pa shes pa'i mjug thogs su mi skye ba shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The unlearned state arises immediately after the knowledge of elimination, like the knowledge of nonarising.

original: gal te mi slob pa'i las slob pa mi 'byung na /
analyzed: gal te mi slob pa'i las slob pa mi 'byung na /
translated: If the learned state does not arise from the unlearned state,

original: 'o na ji ltar na mi slob pa las yongs su nyams pa slob pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar na mi slob pa las yongs su nyams pa slob pa yin zhe na /
translated: then how does the learned state arise from the unlearned state?

original: 'di ltar yongs su nyams pa mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin las yongs su nyams bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su nyams pa mi slob pa'i ting nge 'dzin las yongs su nyams bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, the unlearned state does not degenerate from the unlearned state of concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa las @322a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa las @322a * //
translated: The learned state arises from the unlearned state of concentration.

original: yongs su nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not subject to complete degeneration.

original: de dag ni spyod lam dang bzo'i mngon par 'du bya ba la zhugs pa'i phyir dang / stobs chung ba'i phyir dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag ni spyod lam dang bzo'i mngon par 'du bya ba la zhugs pa'i phyir dang / stobs chung ba'i phyir dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are called weak because they engage in the activities of deportment and skill and because they engage in activities that are effortless.

original: spyod lam pa ni 'gro ba la sogs pa mngon bar 'du bya ba la zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: spyod lam pa ni 'gro ba la sogs pa mngon bar 'du bya ba la zhugs pa yin la /
translated: The mind governing demeanor engages in the activity of going and so on.

original: bzo'i gnas pa ni 'di ni 'di ltar bya'o snyam du bzo mngon par 'du bya ba la zhugs te /
analyzed: bzo'i gnas pa ni 'di ni 'di ltar bya'o snyam du bzo mngon par 'du bya ba la zhugs te /
translated: The mind governing skill engages in the activity of creating skills such as crafts, thinking, I will do this and that.

original: de'i phyir spyod lam dang bzo'i mngon par 'du bya ba lhur byed pa nyid kyis de dag la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba 'dren par mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyod lam dang bzo'i mngon par 'du bya ba lhur byed pa nyid kyis de dag la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba 'dren par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, since they delight in those activities, they cannot induce preparatory states that are the opposite of the activities of deportment and skill.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i phyir rtsol ba med par 'jug pas stobs chung ba dang mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i phyir rtsol ba med par 'jug pas stobs chung ba dang mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug ba zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called weak and effortless because they engage in activities that are effortless, since they engage in activities that are projected by former karma.

original: des na sbyor ba las byung ba 'dren par mi nus so //
analyzed: des na sbyor ba las byung ba 'dren par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it cannot induce the derived from preparation.

original: spyod lam pa dang bzo'i gnas pa gnyis ni lung du ma bstan pa nyid du mtshungs kyang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa las stobs che ste mngon par 'du byed pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod lam pa dang bzo'i gnas pa gnyis ni lung du ma bstan pa nyid du mtshungs kyang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa las stobs che ste mngon par 'du byed pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Both the demeanor and skill in arts and crafts are similar in being neutral, but they are stronger than those arisen from karmic maturation because they are associated with manifest verbal and physical action.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i rjes su mthun pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de 'dren par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i rjes su mthun pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de 'dren par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not compatible with the derived from preparation means it cannot induce it.

original: 'byung ba'i sems ni mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug bas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sems ni mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug bas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind of emergence is engaged without manifest verbal and physical action.

original: 'byung ba'i sems ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems rgyun chad pa'i sems te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sems ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i sems rgyun chad pa'i sems te /
translated: The mind of emergence is the mind that interrupts the continuum of the derived from preparation.

original: de ni mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa yin pa rgyun chad pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa yin pa rgyun chad pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is engaged without manifest verbal and physical action and it is compatible with the interruption of the continuum,

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su 'byung bar mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su 'byung bar mi 'gal lo //
translated: it is not contradictory for it to arise after the derived from preparation.

original: de lta na 'o na nyon mongs pa can dag las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na nyon mongs pa can dag las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then it would not arise from afflicted states either, because they are incompatible with it.

original: gal te sbyor ba las byung ba'i rjes su mi mthun pa'i phyir spyod lam pa la sogs pa dag las mi 'byung na /
analyzed: gal te sbyor ba las byung ba'i rjes su mi mthun pa'i phyir spyod lam pa la sogs pa dag las mi 'byung na /
translated: If it does not arise from the realm of proper conduct and so on because it is incompatible with that which arises from preparation,

original: de ltan 'o na ni yul mngon par 'dod pa lhur len pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyir dang / stobs chung ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa can dag las kyang sbyor ba las byung ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltan 'o na ni yul mngon par 'dod pa lhur len pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyir dang / stobs chung ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa can dag las kyang sbyor ba las byung ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not arise from afflicted states because they are incompatible with it due to the predominance of manifest desire for objects and because they are weak.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos ni dge ba'i chos kyi rjes su mthun par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos ni dge ba'i chos kyi rjes su mthun par mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for an afflicted phenomenon to be compatible with a virtuous phenomenon.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes su mi mthun pa yin mod kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes su mi mthun pa yin mod kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: However, it is compatible with it, but not in the sense of being compatible with it.

original: nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung bas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung bas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: It arises from afflicted states because they are the cause of its arising.

original: nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung bar yongs su shes @322b pa nyid chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung bar yongs su shes @322b pa nyid chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yin la /
translated: The consciousness that is the understanding of the arising of the afflictions is the perseverance for Dharma knowledge and so on.

original: de yang sbyor ba las byung ba yin pas nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su 'byung bar rigs so //
analyzed: de yang sbyor ba las byung ba yin pas nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su 'byung bar rigs so //
translated: Since it is derived from practice, it is reasonable that it arises after the afflicted mind.

original: nyon mongs pa can ni stobs chung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni stobs chung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The afflicted mind is not weak,

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is cultivated from beginningless time.

original: / de'i phyir de nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su 'byung bar mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: / de'i phyir de nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su 'byung bar mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction in its arising after the afflicted mind.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: It arises without motivating activity.

original: ji ltar mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'byung zhe na /
translated: How does it arise without motivating activity?

original: sbyor ba la mi bltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba la mi bltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not depend on preparation.

original: 'o na ji ltar de gsal ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de gsal ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How then is it clear?

original: las su rung ba'i phyir te de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi sa bon yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las su rung ba'i phyir te de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi sa bon yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is pliable, since it is the seed of all roots of virtue.

original: gsal ba'i phyir skyabs byed par nus pas gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su ni 'dod pa na spyod ba'i skyes nas thob pa 'byung ngo //üîΩ'di'i mjug thogs su ni 'di'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i phyir skyabs byed par nus pas gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi mjug thogs su ni 'dod pa na spyod ba'i skyes nas thob pa 'byung ngo // 'di'i mjug thogs su ni 'di'o //
translated: Because it is clear, it is able to serve as refuge. Therefore, the innate mind of the desire realm arises immediately after the afflicted mind of the form realm.üîΩImmediately after this, that arises.

original: 'di ni 'di'i mjug thogs su'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i mjug thogs su'o //
translated: Immediately after this, this arises.

original: zhes sems rnams mjug thogs nyid du 'byung ba bshad la /
analyzed: zhes sems rnams mjug thogs nyid du 'byung ba bshad la /
translated: Thus it explains that minds arise immediately after other minds.üîΩAnd since they arise through the power of attention, it mentions attention:

original: de dag kyang yid la byed pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba de'i phyir yid la byed pa ni gsum ste zhes yid la byed pa nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: de dag kyang yid la byed pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba de'i phyir yid la byed pa ni gsum ste zhes yid la byed pa nye bar bkod do //
translated: There are three types of attention.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa ni gang gis dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa ni gang gis dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Attention to specific characteristics is that by which one focuses on the specific characteristics of things.

original: gzugs ni gnod par byar rung ba'i mtshan nyid can tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rigs pa'i mtshan nyid can no snyam pa la sogs pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni gnod par byar rung ba'i mtshan nyid can tshor ba ni nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rigs pa'i mtshan nyid can no snyam pa la sogs pa'i bar ro //
translated: The defining characteristic of form is that it is suitable to be damaged. The defining characteristic of feeling is experience. The defining characteristic of discrimination is apprehension of specific characteristics. The defining characteristic of formative factors is formation. The defining characteristic of consciousness is cognition.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid yid la byed pa ni gang gis spyi'i mtshan nyid yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid yid la byed pa ni gang gis spyi'i mtshan nyid yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Attention to the general characteristics is attention to the general characteristics of the five aggregates.

original: de ni rnam pa bcu drug dang ldan no //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bcu drug dang ldan no //
translated: It is distinguished by sixteen aspects.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i rnam pa ni spyi'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i rnam pa ni spyi'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The general characteristics of impermanence, etc. are the general characteristics of the five aggregates.

original: rnam pa bcu drug po de dag dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir mos pa yid la byed pa sta /üîΩde ni gang gis mi sdug pa dang tshad med pa la sogs pa dag la mos pa las byung ba'i dmigs pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug po de dag dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir mos pa yid la byed pa sta /üîΩde ni gang gis mi sdug pa dang tshad med pa la sogs pa dag la mos pa las byung ba'i dmigs pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Attention to the general characteristics is distinguished by sixteen aspects, i.e. it is distinguished by the sixteen aspects of the general characteristics.üîΩAttention to the object of the domain of conviction is attention to the object of the domain of conviction.

original: zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa dag la zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'i tshe yang bar mos pa yongs su bzung ngo //üîΩsems mngon par 'du byed pa'i @323a * //
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa dag la zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'i tshe yang bar mos pa yongs su bzung ngo // sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i @323a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the bases of mastery, etc.‚Äù includes the case where one manifests the noble path immediately after the attention of equanimity when one accomplishes the supernormal powers, etc.

original: don gyis na yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: don gyis na yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The meaning of mental attention is the formation of the mind.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni gal te yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum gyi mjug thogs su 'phags pa'i lam mngon du byed na ste /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni gal te yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum gyi mjug thogs su 'phags pa'i lam mngon du byed na ste /
translated: Thus, if one manifests the noble path immediately after the three types of mental attention, then the path is manifested immediately after the attention of equanimity.

original: de'i phyir mi sdug pa dang lhan cig pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ste /üîΩrgyun gyi bar dang bcas pa dang / bar med par 'dren pa'i phyir mi sdug pa dang lhan cig pa zhes bya'i sems gcig la ni ma yin te mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'phags pa'i lam yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi sdug pa dang lhan cig pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ste / rgyun gyi bar dang bcas pa dang / bar med par 'dren pa'i phyir mi sdug pa dang lhan cig pa zhes bya'i sems gcig la ni ma yin te mi srid pa'i phyir ro // dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ni 'phags pa'i lam yin la /
translated: Therefore, the text says, ‚Äúthe path is manifested immediately after the attention of equanimity that is accompanied by the meditation on the impurity of the object.‚Äù

analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid yid la byed pa'i mjug thogs su yang 'byung ngo zhes don gyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is also generated immediately after the attention directed to intrinsic characteristics.

original: de ltar na yid la byed pa gsum 'phags pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba yin no zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yid la byed pa gsum 'phags pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba yin no zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it is understood that the three attentions are preparations for the noble path.

original: gzhan dag na re spyi yid la byed pa kho na'i mjug thogs su zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re spyi yid la byed pa kho na'i mjug thogs su zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Others say that the noble path arises immediately after the attention directed to generality, etc.

original: mi rtag ba la sogs pa mthong ba nyid na 'phags pa'i lam skye ba'i phyir dang gzhan gnyis po 'phags pa'i lam dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag ba la sogs pa mthong ba nyid na 'phags pa'i lam skye ba'i phyir dang gzhan gnyis po 'phags pa'i lam dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the noble path arises when one sees impermanence, etc., and because the other two are not similar to the noble path.üîΩFrom that, three types arise.

original: de las ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la thams cad kyis ldang bar mi 'gal bas 'dir nges pa ma byas so //
analyzed: de las ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la thams cad kyis ldang bar mi 'gal bas 'dir nges pa ma byas so //
translated: Since it is not contradictory that all arise from that, it is not specified here.

original: gal te mos pa yid la byed pa'i mjug thogs su 'phags pa'i lam la snyoms par mi 'jug na'o na mi sdug pa dang lhan cig pa'i zhes rgya cher 'byung ba 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir mi sdug pas sems btul nas zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na mi sdug pa ni spyi yid la byed pa'i sbyor ba yin pas brgyud pa las gsungs so zhes zer ro //

analyzed: gal te mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa sa gsum la brten nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore it is said:üîΩ‚ÄúAfter one has subdued the mind with repulsiveness,‚ÄùüîΩand thus it is said that repulsiveness is the preparation for attention directed to joy.üîΩIf one enters meditative attainment in the ƒÅrya path immediately after attention that is directed to joy, then how do you interpret this passage from the sutra:üîΩ‚ÄúIf one is cultivating the meditation of repulsiveness, one should not enter meditative attainment in the ƒÅrya path.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore it is said:üîΩ‚ÄúAfter one has subdued the mind with repulsiveness,‚Äù

original: mthong ba'i lams gsum la brten pa'i mjug thogs su ni 'dod pa na spyod ba'i thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / skyes nas thob pa spyi yid la byed pa rnam pa bcu drug dang ldan pa mngon du byed par 'gyur te de ni nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te bsam gtan gnyis ba la sogs pa la brten nas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi pa la brten nas nges pa la 'jug na mthong ba'i lam gyi mjug thogs su 'dod pa na spyod pa'i spyi yid @323b la byed

translated: Immediately after the three paths of seeing, one manifests the mental contemplation of the universal form of beings in the desire realm that is obtained from birth, and that possesses the sixteen aspects of the four truths, because that is close.

analyzed: gal te bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa ba kho na mngon du byed par 'gyur bas nyes pa 'di med do zhe na de'i phyir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ma gtogs par de dag gis pa yang ma thob po zhes bya ba smos
translated: If you think that this fault does not exist because they manifest only on the level of the second absorption and so on, then the text says, they do not obtain those levels except for the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: te / 'di ltar 'bras bu dang po'i skad cig ma 'di 'jig rten pa bsgom pas mi 'thob po //
analyzed: te / 'di ltar 'bras bu dang po'i skad cig ma 'di 'jig rten pa bsgom pas mi 'thob po //

original: yang gang zhig ma thob pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang gang zhig ma thob pa de gang zhe na /

original: nyams pa dang / gnas ba dang / khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa dang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: nyams pa dang / gnas ba dang / khyad par gyi cha dang mthun pa dang rnam pa gsum mo //

analyzed: de lta na 'o na bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa kho na mngon du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then they would manifest only the factors conducive to penetrative insight on the level of the second absorption and so on.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa mngon du mdzad pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa mngon du mdzad pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore the text says, noble beings do not manifest the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: de nyid la rgyu smos pa ni 'bras bu thob zin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smos pa ni 'bras bu thob zin pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The cause of that is stated: ‚Äúhaving already attained the result‚Äù and so on.

original: sbyor ba'i dgos pa bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dgos pa bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because the purpose of preparation has already been accomplished,

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba yang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams yin pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba yang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams yin pas /

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu gnas pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa mngon du byed pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu gnas pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa mngon du byed pa mi rigs so //
translated: it is illogical that the result of abiding would manifest the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: des ni de dang 'dra ba spyi yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des ni de dang 'dra ba spyi yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang 'dra ba de mngon du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is manifested that is similar to the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: de nyid ston pa ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: de skad du ni mi brjod do //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de skad du ni mi brjod do // zhes bya ba la /

original: sbyor ba'i sems la rag las pa rnams kyang 'bras bu'i gong du mngon du 'gyur ba mi rung ngo zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sems la rag las pa rnams kyang 'bras bu'i gong du mngon du 'gyur ba mi rung ngo zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is illogical that those that depend on the mind of preparation would manifest above the result.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag mngon du gyur na spyi yid la byed pa gzhan bsgom pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag mngon du gyur na spyi yid la byed pa gzhan bsgom pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: When the factors conducive to penetrative insight manifest, it is not that one does not cultivate other general mental attentions.

analyzed: gang gi phyir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa mngon du gyur na rnam pa 'dra ba kho na sgom par byed la /

original: 'dra ba yang mthong ba'i lam kho na ma 'ongs pa nyid kyis bsgoms na 'di ni 'du byed kyi chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir mi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba yang mthong ba'i lam kho na ma 'ongs pa nyid kyis bsgoms na 'di ni 'du byed kyi chos thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir mi 'dra ba yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam gyi mjug thogs su yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum mngon du byed pa @324a * //

analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba las gzhan du nyon mongs pa can las so //

translated: When linking with the roots of virtue through doubt, doubt is an affliction and the mind concomitant with it is also afflicted.

translated: Thus, one obtains a virtuous mind from two types of minds, because the mind of birth linking is afflicted when concomitant with doubt.

translated: Obtaining a nonvirtuous mind and a obscured neutral mind and so on.

analyzed: bsgribs pa mngon du 'gyur na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mi dge ba dang bsgribs pa'i sems rnyed do //

translated: when one dies in the formless realm and is reborn in the desire realm, one obtains afflicted states of the form realm.

analyzed: yongs su nyams pa las zhes bya ba la / 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pa nas /

translated: when one falls from freedom from attachment to the desire realm, one obtains the unwholesome and obscured states of the desire realm.

original: stobs chung ba'i phyir ro //

original: stobs chung ba ni rten stobs dang ldan pa la ma ltos par 'byung bar mi nus so //üîΩde'i phyir de ni gzugs la brten nas 'jug go / des na ris dang srog kyang brten nas 'jug ste /

original: de nyid kyang stobs chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyang stobs chung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: des na ci'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyid yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i sems kyi rgyud de /

original: de bzhin du ji srid reg bya rnams reg nas yid dga'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rtogs par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji srid reg bya rnams reg nas yid dga'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rtogs par ni mi bya'o //
translated: In the same way, you should not understand that the mind is pleased by contact with tangible objects.

original: mthong ba dang thos pa dang bsnams pa dang myangs pa dang reg pa rnams ni yul gyi 'dod pa rnams nye bar longs spyod pa yin pas /
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos pa dang bsnams pa dang myangs pa dang reg pa rnams ni yul gyi 'dod pa rnams nye bar longs spyod pa yin pas /
translated: Seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, and touching are the enjoyment of the objects of desire.

original: khyod kyi ston pa 'dod @332a * //
analyzed: khyod kyi ston pa 'dod @332a * //
translated: Your teacher, who is free from desire,

original: chags dang bral ba yang gzugs dang por mthong ba nyid na 'dod pa nye bar spyad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chags dang bral ba yang gzugs dang por mthong ba nyid na 'dod pa nye bar spyad par 'gyur ro //
translated: would enjoy the objects of desire when he first sees a form.

original: kho bo cag gi ltar na dge slong 'dod chags dang ma bral bas 'dod chags ma spangs pa ni yid kyi sgo nas yin la lus dang ngag gi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ltar na dge slong 'dod chags dang ma bral bas 'dod chags ma spangs pa ni yid kyi sgo nas yin la lus dang ngag gi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: According to us, a monk who is not free from desire, who has not abandoned desire, does so by means of the mind, not by means of body and speech.

original: gal te yul rnams la 'dod chags kho na nye bar longs spyod pa yin na nye bar longs spyod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir 'di'i snga rol du tshor ba ni yul nye bar longs spyod pa ste 'dod chags tshor ba sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yul rnams la 'dod chags kho na nye bar longs spyod pa yin na nye bar longs spyod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir 'di'i snga rol du tshor ba ni yul nye bar longs spyod pa ste 'dod chags tshor ba sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: If one were to enjoy only the object of attachment, then feeling would precede enjoyment, since enjoyment is prior to attachment.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i dang / zag pa med pa rnams kun tu sbyong la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i dang / zag pa med pa rnams kun tu sbyong la /
translated: In the realm of desire, one cultivates the formless and form realms and the pure factors when one enters meditative attainment.

original: gzhan gyi tshe ni thob pa'o //üîΩgzugs kyi khams na ni 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa'i sems /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe ni thob pa'o // gzugs kyi khams na ni 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa'i sems /
translated: At other times, one obtains them.

original: gzugs med pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kun tu spyod do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kun tu spyod do //
translated: In the realm of form, one cultivates the factors of the formless realm and the pure factors, and the mind of emanation belonging to the realm of desire.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni zag pa pa med pa kho na kun tu spyod do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni zag pa pa med pa kho na kun tu spyod do //
translated: In the formless realm, one cultivates only the pure factors.

original: de'i phyir dri ba ni yang ci gang dag la 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dag rgyas par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dri ba ni yang ci gang dag la 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dag rgyas par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, the question is asked: ‚ÄúAre there any factors in which the attachment of the realms of desire and form can increase?‚Äù

original: ci rigs bar dmigs pa 'am mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: ci rigs bar dmigs pa 'am mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: They are established by means of their focal object or by means of their concomitance.üîΩNow, they are like a horse and its trappings.

original: da ni 'di rta dang bres lta bu yin te zhes bya ba la 'di rta brtod sa'i yin pa ni bres so //
analyzed: da ni 'di rta dang bres lta bu yin te zhes bya ba la 'di rta brtod sa'i yin pa ni bres so //
translated: The horse is the one that is ridden, and the trappings are the saddle, the bridle, and so on.

original: gnyis ka yang mi shes pa'i phyir bres dang 'dra ba ni bres lta bu ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka yang mi shes pa'i phyir bres dang 'dra ba ni bres lta bu ste /
translated: Since neither is known without the other, they are like a horse and its trappings.üîΩIn the same way, the realms are established by means of attachment and attachment is established by means of the realms.üîΩIf you say that neither is established, then the elder Vasubandhu says:

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang 'dod chags dag gis khams rnams bsgrub cing khams rnams kyis kyang 'dod chags dag yin pas 'di gnyis ka yang mi 'grub bo zhe na gnas brtan de dag la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'iüîΩ'dod chags yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang 'dod chags dag gis khams rnams bsgrub cing khams rnams kyis kyang 'dod chags dag yin pas 'di gnyis ka yang mi 'grub bo zhe na gnas brtan de dag la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags yin la /
translated: Attachment that is not free from the realms is attachment to the desire realm.

original: de gang du rgyas par 'gyur ba'i chos de yang 'dod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de gang du rgyas par 'gyur ba'i chos de yang 'dod pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The phenomena in which that attachment increases are also associated with the desire realm.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The same is true of the form realm and the formless realm.

original: gong ma'i gnas dag bcu bdun ni zhes gzugs kyi khams su gnas brtan pa'i gnas de dag la 'og ma'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags yin la /
analyzed: gong ma'i gnas dag bcu bdun ni zhes gzugs kyi khams su gnas brtan pa'i gnas de dag la 'og ma'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi 'dod chags yin la /
translated: Attachment to the form realm is attachment to the form realm that is freedom from attachment to the lower realm.

original: de gang du rgyas par 'gyur ba'i chos de yang gzugs dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de gang du rgyas par 'gyur ba'i chos de yang gzugs dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The phenomena that increase that attachment are also associated with the form realm.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med khams na gnas med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med khams na gnas med do //
translated: Similarly, there are no abodes in the formless realm.

original: skye ba las ni de rnam bzhi //
analyzed: skye ba las ni de rnam bzhi //
translated: They are four due to birth.

original: @332b zhes gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba bstan pa de dag la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags yin la /
analyzed: @332b zhes gzugs med pa'i khams su skye ba bstan pa de dag la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags yin la /
translated: Attachment to the formless realm is attachment to the formless realm that is not freedom from attachment to the formless realm.

original: de gang du rgyas par 'gyur ba de yang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de gang du rgyas par 'gyur ba de yang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The phenomena that increase that attachment are also associated with the formless realm.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med par skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag la 'dod chags pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med par skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag la 'dod chags pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: Attachment to birth in the absorptions and formless realm and to meditative attainment is attachment to the form and formless realms.

original: yang 'di dag gi khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di dag gi khyad par ci zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between these two?

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: sngar ni snod kyi 'dod chags bshad la da ni rgyu dang bcas pas sems can gyi 'dod chags zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sngar ni snod kyi 'dod chags bshad la da ni rgyu dang bcas pas sems can gyi 'dod chags zhes zer ro //
translated: Previously, attachment to the desire realm was explained, but now attachment to sentient beings is said to be attachment to the desire realm together with its cause.

original: gzhan dag 'di ni rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'di ni rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: This is correct.

original: de nyid bde blag tu khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid bde blag tu khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan pa ni /
translated: In order to easily understand that, it is taught by another enumeration:

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bzhin zhes so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bzhin zhes so //
translated: Like attachment to the desire realm.üîΩHow is attachment to the desire realm like attachment to the desire realm?

original: sprul pa'i sems la ji ltar 'dod pa'i 'dod chags pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa'i sems ni 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kho na'i bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems la ji ltar 'dod pa'i 'dod chags pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa'i sems ni 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kho na'i bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu yin la /
translated: A desire realm mind of emanation is the result of absorption dhyƒÅna of those who are free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags 'byung ba yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags 'byung ba yang ma yin zhing /
translated: Attachment to the desire realm does not arise in those free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rgyas par mi 'gyur ba ni 'dod par gtogs pa yin par 'os pa yang yin no zhes 'gal bar mthong ba can gyi dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags rgyas par mi 'gyur ba ni 'dod par gtogs pa yin par 'os pa yang yin no zhes 'gal bar mthong ba can gyi dri ba'o //
translated: This is the question of one who sees a contradiction.üîΩBecause they hear about it and degenerate and then become attached to it.

original: thos pa dang yongs su nyams nas de la chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la rnal 'byor pa rnams ni de ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa sprul par byed do //
analyzed: thos pa dang yongs su nyams nas de la chags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la rnal 'byor pa rnams ni de ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa sprul par byed do //
translated: Thus yogis emanate a desire realm emanation through a desire realm emanating mind.

original: zhes thos nas de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags skye la /
analyzed: zhes thos nas de la dmigs pa'i 'dod chags skye la /
translated: Having heard about it, attachment to it arises.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams te /
translated: They degenerate from freedom from attachment to the desire realm.

original: rjes su dran nas sprul pa'i sems la chags par byed do //
analyzed: rjes su dran nas sprul pa'i sems la chags par byed do //
translated: Remembering it, they become attached to the emanating mind.

original: yang na sprul ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang na sprul ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Or, because of the power of emanation.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa mthong nas aa ma kye ma bdag la yang 'di 'dra ba'i sems yod par gyur cig snyam du sprul bar byed pa'i sems la yang 'dod pa nyon mongs pa can 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa mthong nas aa ma kye ma bdag la yang 'di 'dra ba'i sems yod par gyur cig snyam du sprul bar byed pa'i sems la yang 'dod pa nyon mongs pa can 'byung ngo //
translated: When one sees a desire realm emanation, one thinks, Alas, I too have such a mind and afflicted desire realm attachment arises toward the emanating mind.

original: yang na dri dang ro sprul pa'i phyir na sprul pa'i sems de 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang na dri dang ro sprul pa'i phyir na sprul pa'i sems de 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid yin no //
translated: Or else, because it emanates smell and taste, the emanating mind is of the desire realm.

original: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni gzugs @333a * //
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni gzugs @333a * //
translated: The reason for that is stated:

original: na spyod pas ni de gnyis sprul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: na spyod pas ni de gnyis sprul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because form realm beings emanate those two.

original: dri dang ro dag ni kham gyi zas nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod par gtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dri dang ro dag ni kham gyi zas nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod par gtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: Smell and taste are only of the desire realm because they are oral food.

original: sa gzhan gyi bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu ni sa gzhan gyi sprul pa mi 'phrul la /
analyzed: sa gzhan gyi bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu ni sa gzhan gyi sprul pa mi 'phrul la /
translated: The emanation of another level is not emanated by the result of another level.

original: de dag kham gyi zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir dri dang ro sprul par yang mi rigs so /
analyzed: de dag kham gyi zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir dri dang ro sprul par yang mi rigs so /
translated: And because they are free from attachment to oral food, it is illogical that they emanate smell and taste.

original: gal te sa dang khams skal ba mi mnyam pa la rgyas par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rang gi khams pa'i phra rgyas thams cad kyi khams bstan par 'gal ba med bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te sa dang khams skal ba mi mnyam pa la rgyas par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rang gi khams pa'i phra rgyas thams cad kyi khams bstan par 'gal ba med bzhin du /
translated: If it is not extended to realms and levels of different types, then it would contradict the teaching that all the negative tendencies of one‚Äôs own realm are extended.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod chags kho nas bsnyad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod chags kho nas bsnyad ce na /
translated: Why is it explained only through attachment?

original: phal cher rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: phal cher rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is extended the most.

original: 'di ltar sems can rnams ni yang dang yang du 'dod chags kho na la kun tu spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams ni yang dang yang du 'dod chags kho na la kun tu spyod pa yin no //
translated: Thus sentient beings repeatedly engage in attachment.

original: gang 'dod pa'i khams gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i khams gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: One who is free from attachment to one desire realm is free from attachment to all desire realms.

original: de lta ma yin na khams gsum dag mtha' yas pa'i phyir gcig tu grol ba gzhan du bcings pas thar ba med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na khams gsum dag mtha' yas pa'i phyir gcig tu grol ba gzhan du bcings pas thar ba med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then since the three realms are infinite, one liberated in one realm would not be liberated in other realms, and liberation would not exist.

original: de kho na yod pa'i tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de kho na yod pa'i tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the Brahma realm where reality exists‚Äù occurs.

original: de lta ma yin na ston pa ltar thams cad kyi 'gro ba mtha' thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ston pa ltar thams cad kyi 'gro ba mtha' thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that all beings would have an endless series of rebirths, like the Teacher.

original: khams bshad zin to /
analyzed: khams bshad zin to /
translated: The realms have been explained.

original: // / da ni 'gro ba rnams brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni 'gro ba rnams brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the destinies will be discussed.

original: 'di dag kyang gang dang gang du na yin pa mi shes te de'i phyir khams gsum po bshad pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang gang dang gang du na yin pa mi shes te de'i phyir khams gsum po bshad pa gang yin pa /
translated: Since it is not known where these realms are located, the root text states,

original: der ni dmyal sogs 'gro ba lnga //
analyzed: der ni dmyal sogs 'gro ba lnga //
translated: The three realms are the five destinies of hell beings and so on.

original: rang gis ming gis bstan zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rang gis ming gis bstan zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The destinies are taught by their own names.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni tha dad pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni tha dad pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the relationship between the support and the supported is seen to be distinct.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang gis na de dag khams dag tu zhes bya ba 'dir rgyas par bris so //üîΩkhams rnams na 'gro ba 'ba' zhig yin par ma zad kyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang gis na de dag khams dag tu zhes bya ba 'dir rgyas par bris so // khams rnams na 'gro ba 'ba' zhig yin par ma zad kyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: For this reason, the root text states,üîΩThe destinies are not only in the realms.

original: 'gro ba ma gtogs pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma gtogs pa yang yod do //
translated: But what exists apart from the destinies?üîΩThe root text states,

original: de rnams ni dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de rnams ni dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The destinies are virtuous, afflicted, and neutral.

original: 'dir ni khams 'gro ba ma gtogs par yod par bstan pa'i phyir khams dag tu 'gro ba rnams zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir ni khams 'gro ba ma gtogs par yod par bstan pa'i phyir khams dag tu 'gro ba rnams zhes bshad do //
translated: Here, in order to indicate that the realms exist apart from the destinies, the root text states, ‚Äúthe destinies within the realms.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs can min lung bstan min //
analyzed: nyon mongs can min lung bstan min //
translated: They are not afflicted, nor are they declared.

original: zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa smos pa ni nyon mongs pa can @333b rnam par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa smos pa ni nyon mongs pa can @333b rnam par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey are not afflicted‚Äù is stated in order to exclude the afflicted.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ma yin pa smos pa ni dge ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ma yin pa smos pa ni dge ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnor are they declared‚Äù is stated in order to exclude the wholesome.

original: sems can zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúsentient beings‚Äù is stated in order to exclude the physical cosmos.

original: 'gro ba rnams ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na'o //
translated: The destinies are only unobscured and undefined.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are by nature karmic maturation.

original: 'di ni de dag sems can du ston pa nyid du bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni de dag sems can du ston pa nyid du bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This will be explained as the quality of being a sentient being.

original: sems can du ston pa la rnam par smin pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa la rnam par smin pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is possible for a sentient being to experience karmic maturation.

original: de lta ma yin na 'gro ba 'chol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams 'dres pa'i ngo bo ste tha mi dad ces bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'gro ba 'chol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba rnams 'dres pa'i ngo bo ste tha mi dad ces bya ba'i don to ;
translated: Otherwise, the realms would be confused, that is, the realms would have a confused nature, meaning they would not be distinct.

original: / gal te 'gro ba dag lung ma bstan pa nyid du mi 'dod na sems can rnams phal cher 'gro ba gzhan gyi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dag dang yang ldan no //üîΩlung du ma bstan pa dag dang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: / gal te 'gro ba dag lung ma bstan pa nyid du mi 'dod na sems can rnams phal cher 'gro ba gzhan gyi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dag dang yang ldan no // lung du ma bstan pa dag dang ni ma yin te /
translated: If you do not assert that the realms are neutral, then sentient beings would possess the virtue and affliction of other realms.

original: de dag gi thob pa lhan cig skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi thob pa lhan cig skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But they do not possess neutral states because the obtainment of those states arises simultaneously.

original: yang na 'gro ba thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba'i las rnams mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba'i rgyu yin la de rnams kyang 'gro ba gzhan dag der gtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba'i las rnams mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba'i rgyu yin la de rnams kyang 'gro ba gzhan dag der gtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, karma that establishes all realms is the cause of the human and other realms, and those realms are included in other realms.

original: de lta na mi la sogs pa'i 'gro bar dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na mi la sogs pa'i 'gro bar dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would follow that the realms of hell and so on would exist in the human and other realms.

original: 'gro ba rnams ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa med la srid pa bar ma'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di go ga las she na /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa med la srid pa bar ma'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di go ga las she na /

analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyang sems can zhes bya ba kho na yin no // zhes shes par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gal te yang snod kyi rang bzhin 'gro ba rnams su gyur na / 'gro bar byed @334a * //

analyzed: ci zhig ma bsdus she na /

analyzed: srid pa bar ma'o zhes 'byung ba las na /

original: de brdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas kyis bsdus kyang /
analyzed: de brdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas kyis bsdus kyang /
translated: Although the intermediate existence is included in the birth existence of the spontaneous,
