analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su ma 'dus pa'i phyir 'gro ba srid pa bar ma ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par 'gyur ro //

original: de lta ma yin na skye ba'i srid pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar de yang 'gro bas bsdus par 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir srid pa bar ma de 'gro ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na skye ba'i srid pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar de yang 'gro bas bsdus par 'gyur ro // de'i phyir srid pa bar ma de 'gro ba'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: If it were otherwise, then like birth existence and so on, it would be included in the destinies.üîΩTherefore the intermediate existence is not of the nature of the destinies.

original: yang 'gro ba srid pa bar ma ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang 'gro ba srid pa bar ma ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The intermediate existence is not a destiny.

original: bstan bcos gnyis pa dper brjod pa ni chos kyi phung po las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos gnyis pa dper brjod pa ni chos kyi phung po las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The second treatise, the Exposition, also states:

original: 'di las ni bsgoms pa las byung ba ltar srid pa bar ma pa yang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i mig gi dbang po las tha dad par logs shig tu bstan te /
analyzed: 'di las ni bsgoms pa las byung ba ltar srid pa bar ma pa yang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i mig gi dbang po las tha dad par logs shig tu bstan te /

original: de'i phyir de yang bsgom pa las byung ba ltar dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bas bsdus pa ma yin pas srid pa bar ma 'gro ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //

translated: Therefore it is taught that the intermediate existence is not subsumed by the reincarnating beings of hell beings and so on, just as it is not subsumed by the reincarnating beings of those arisen from meditation.

original: gzhan du na ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i mig gis srid pa bar ma pa yang bstan pas yang ci'i phyir brjod /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i mig gis srid pa bar ma pa yang bstan pas yang ci'i phyir brjod /

original: bstan bcos las srid pa bar ma 'gro ba rnams las logs shig tu mdzad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos las srid pa bar ma 'gro ba rnams las logs shig tu mdzad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Not only does the treatise differentiate the intermediate existence from the reincarnating beings, but it also states:

original: mdo las kyang srid pa bar ma 'gro ba rnams las logs shig mdzad do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mdo las kyang srid pa bar ma 'gro ba rnams las logs shig mdzad do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The intermediate existence of beings is separate from the five types of migration.üîΩThe source for the statement that the intermediate existence is not a type of migration and that the five types of migration are neutral is this sutra, which separately mentions the existence of karma and intermediate existence, since it states:

original: srid pa bar ma 'gro ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / 'gro ba rnams lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyi khungs ni las kyi srid pa dang / srid pa bar ma'o zhes dmyal ba la sogs pa dag las logs shig tu smos pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma 'gro ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / 'gro ba rnams lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyi khungs ni las kyi srid pa dang / srid pa bar ma'o zhes dmyal ba la sogs pa dag las logs shig tu smos pa 'di yin no //
translated: The existence of karma and intermediate existence are separate from the hells and so on.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa dang 'gro ba dang bcas bar bshad do zhes bya ba la 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyu ni las kyi srid pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa dang 'gro ba dang bcas bar bshad do zhes bya ba la 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyu ni las kyi srid pa yin la /
translated: It explains that the five types of migration are accompanied by their causes. The cause of the five types of migration is the existence of karma.

original: 'gro ba ni srid pa bar ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni srid pa bar ma yin te /
translated: The five types of migration are the intermediate existence,

original: 'dis 'gro bar byed pas na zhes byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis 'gro bar byed pas na zhes byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are called migration since they migrate by means of this.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo'i phyir ro //

original: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i rgyu las kyi srid pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i rgyu las kyi srid pa ste /
translated: Its cause means the cause of the five types of migration, the existence of karma.

original: 'gro ba @334b dag las logs shin tu mdzad pa'i phyir 'gro ba rnams ma bsgrigs la lung du ma bstan pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba @334b dag las logs shin tu mdzad pa'i phyir 'gro ba rnams ma bsgrigs la lung du ma bstan pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: Since they are not created by sentient beings, they are established as unobscured and undefined.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi skyon dang snyigs ma de dag gis zhes bya ba la lus kyi skyon dang ngag gi skyon dang yid kyi skyon no zhes bya ba rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi skyon dang snyigs ma de dag gis zhes bya ba la lus kyi skyon dang ngag gi skyon dang yid kyi skyon no zhes bya ba rig par bya'o //

original: chos de dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos de dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Except for those phenomena,

original: dmyal ba dag tu gzugs la sogs pa gang dag rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa de dag kho na dmyal ba yin gyi de dag las gzhan pa'i dmyal ba dge ba'am mi dge ba'i chos ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dmyal ba dag tu gzugs la sogs pa gang dag rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid du grub pa de dag kho na dmyal ba yin gyi de dag las gzhan pa'i dmyal ba dge ba'am mi dge ba'i chos ni mi dmigs so //
translated: in the hells, form and so on that are established as the nature of karmic maturation are called hell beings, but other phenomena that are virtuous or nonvirtuous are not observed apart from them.üîΩAfter karmic maturation is established, they are counted as hell beings.

original: rnam par smin pa grub nas dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'gro ba rnams ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin zhes bya ba 'di la khungs ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa grub nas dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'gro ba rnams ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin zhes bya ba 'di la khungs ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the source for the statement that reincarnating beings are unobscured and undefined.

original: rnam par smin pa'i gnas skabs ni dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i gnas skabs ni dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin no //
translated: The state of karmic maturation is not wholesome or afflicted.

original: srid pa bar ma'i rang bzhin dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams so zhes shes par byas par 'gyur ro //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir sems can zhes bya ba yang grub ste /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'i rang bzhin dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams so zhes shes par byas par 'gyur ro // de nyid kyi phyir sems can zhes bya ba yang grub ste /
translated: The state of karmic maturation is the intermediate existence of hell beings and so on.üîΩTherefore it is established that it is a sentient being because

original: rnam par smin pa ni sems can du brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni sems can du brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the state of karmic maturation is called a sentient being.

original: dmyal ba'i 'gro ba ni 'di dper brjod pa tsam zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i 'gro ba ni 'di dper brjod pa tsam zhig tu zad do //
translated: The realm of hell beings is merely an example.

original: 'o na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na rab tu byed pa'i gzhung zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the meaning of the treatise topic?

original: 'dir ci la lan gdab par bya /
analyzed: 'dir ci la lan gdab par bya /
translated: What is the answer here?üîΩBecause the realms are unobscured neutral states, they are objects abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: 'gro ba rnams ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid yin la bsgom pas spang bar bya ba la yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / phra rgyas kun tu 'gro ba rnams rgyas par 'gyur gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin te /

translated: Since they are objects abandoned by the path of meditation, pervasive negative tendencies increase in them, but not others.

original: de'i phyir thams cad smos pa la lan gdab par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad smos pa la lan gdab par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, you must respond to the objection that all of these are mentioned.

original: rnam pa lnga nyid yin na yang de dag dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga nyid yin na yang de dag dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can nyid du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though they are five types, they are also virtuous and afflicted.üîΩThere are five types of minds that link to the realms of existence,

original: 'gro ba rnams su nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems rnam pa lnga yod de zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems rnam pa lnga yod de zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams so //
translated: that is, those that are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, and those to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: 'jug pa dang bcas pa'i 'gro ba rnams smos pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang bcas pa'i 'gro ba rnams smos pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The realms of existence are mentioned because they are associated with entry.

original: 'dir 'gro ba smos pas ni 'jug pa dang lhan cig pa'i 'gro ba gzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'gro ba smos pas ni 'jug pa dang lhan cig pa'i 'gro ba gzung ste /
translated: Here the realms of existence are mentioned because they include the realms of existence that are associated with entry.

original: 'gro ba'i 'jug pa la 'gro ba nye bar btags @335a * //üîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i 'jug pa la 'gro ba nye bar btags @335a * // pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The entry to the realms of existence is designated as the realms of existence.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi 'jug pa yang nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems dag yin la /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi 'jug pa yang nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems dag yin la /
translated: The entry to the realms of existence is the minds that link to the realms of existence.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems kyi 'og rol gyi ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyud la 'gro ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems kyi 'og rol gyi ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyud la 'gro ba zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called ‚Äúgoing‚Äù in the continuum of an unobscured neutral mind that occurs after the mind of birth linking.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa lnga yin pa de'i phyir 'gro ba dag la phra rgyas thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam pa lnga yin pa de'i phyir 'gro ba dag la phra rgyas thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ro // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since those are five types, all negative tendencies increase in the reincarnating beings.üîΩThe example is stated in that passage.

original: de nyid la dpe smos pa ni grong smos na grong gi nye 'khor yang smos pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid la dpe smos pa ni grong smos na grong gi nye 'khor yang smos pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as when a town is mentioned, its outskirts are also mentioned.

original: ji ltar grong smos na grong gi nye 'khor smos pa yin zhe na /üîΩgrong 'di na s'a lu'i zhing yod do //
analyzed: ji ltar grong smos na grong gi nye 'khor smos pa yin zhe na / grong 'di na s'a lu'i zhing yod do //
translated: How is it that when a town is mentioned, its outskirts are also mentioned?üîΩBecause when one says, this town has a rice field,

original: 'bru'i zhing yod do zhes smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bru'i zhing yod do zhes smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it also has a barley field.

original: dper na snyigs ma lnga po dag tu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na snyigs ma lnga po dag tu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: For example, in the five degenerations,

analyzed: tshe dang skal pa dang nyon mongs pa dang lta ba dang sems can gyi snyigs ma dag tu'o //
translated: the degenerations of lifespan, era, afflictions, views, and sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin du khyad par med kyang nyon mongs pa dag las lta ba'i snyigs ma dag tha dad du bzhag pa ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin du khyad par med kyang nyon mongs pa dag las lta ba'i snyigs ma dag tha dad du bzhag pa ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there is no difference in the nature of the afflictions, the defilements of view are presented separately from the afflictions because they are governed by the categories of laypeople and monastics.

original: 'gro ba'i rgyu shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyu shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to understand the cause of reincarnating beings.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyu ni las kyi srid pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyu ni las kyi srid pa yin te /
translated: The cause of reincarnating beings is karmic existence.

original: de'i phyir de 'gro ba'i rang bzhin yin yang 'gro ba'i rgyu shes par bya ba'i phyir tha dad du smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'gro ba'i rang bzhin yin yang 'gro ba'i rgyu shes par bya ba'i phyir tha dad du smos so //
translated: Therefore, although it is the nature of reincarnating beings, it is mentioned separately in order to understand the cause of reincarnating beings.üîΩThis would also apply to the intermediate existence.

original: 'di ni srid pa bar ma la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la tha dad par smos kyang 'gro ba yin par 'gyur na ni 'gro ba'i rang bzhin kho nas 'gro ba shes par bya ba'i phyir tha dad du bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa bar ma la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la tha dad par smos kyang 'gro ba yin par 'gyur na ni 'gro ba'i rang bzhin kho nas 'gro ba shes par bya ba'i phyir tha dad du bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it is mentioned separately, if it were a reincarnating being, it would be taught separately in order to understand that it is a reincarnating being by its very nature as a reincarnating being.

original: srid pa bar ma yin pa kho na'i phyir zhes bya ba la gang nas 'chi 'pho ba dang gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba de gnyis kyi bar du 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma 'gro ba ma yin no //üîΩsrid pa bar ma ni 'gro ba'i bar ma do yin no //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma yin pa kho na'i phyir zhes bya ba la gang nas 'chi 'pho ba dang gang du 'gro bar 'gyur ba de gnyis kyi bar du 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma 'gro ba ma yin no // srid pa bar ma ni 'gro ba'i bar ma do yin no //
translated: Because it is an intermediate existence. It is an intermediate existence because it occurs between death and the place where one will go.üîΩAn intermediate existence is the interval between two destinies.

original: 'gro ba'i bar ma do ni 'gro bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bar ma do ni 'gro bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible to go in the interval between two destinies.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says:

original: srid pa bar ma ni bgrod par bya ba ma yin pas 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ni bgrod par bya ba ma yin pas 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: An intermediate existence is not a destiny because it is not a place to be traversed.

original: 'chi 'pho ba'i yul nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba'i yul nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because one is born in the very place where one dies.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gzugs med pa rnams kyang 'chi 'pho ba'i yul nyid du skye bas srid pa bar ma bzhin du 'gro ba ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams kyang 'chi 'pho ba'i yul nyid du skye bas srid pa bar ma bzhin du 'gro ba ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would follow that the formless realm would not be a destiny, since one is born in the very place where one dies.

original: 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir las kyi srid pa yang srid pa bar ma @335b bzhin 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir las kyi srid pa yang srid pa bar ma @335b bzhin 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: Also karmic existence would not be a destiny, because it is the cause of a destiny, like an intermediate existence.

original: gal te 'gro ba rnams dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can yang yin na rnam par smin pa grub nas zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar drang zhe na rnam par smin pa grub nas dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can yang dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs suüîΩ'gro bas 'gal ba med de /üîΩ'di ltar gal te 'di rnam par smin pa kho na grub nas dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba rnams dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can yang yin na rnam par smin pa grub nas zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar drang zhe na rnam par smin pa grub nas dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can yang dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro bas 'gal ba med de / 'di ltar gal te 'di rnam par smin pa kho na grub nas dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: There is no contradiction, because having established its karmic maturation, it is counted as virtuous and afflicted hell beings.

original: zhes de skad du gsungs na ni de'i phyir phung po gzhan bkag par rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig go /'o na tshe dang ldan pa de la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /

analyzed: rdzogs par byed pa dag gis ni rdzogs par byed de /

original: gcig gis skye ba gcig 'phen te /
analyzed: gcig gis skye ba gcig 'phen te /

original: yongs rdzogs byed pa du ma @341a * //
analyzed: yongs rdzogs byed pa du ma @341a * //

analyzed: ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: rigs pa dang lung las te zhes bya ba la rigs pa dang lung rkyang pa dag tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga nye bar bkod do //

original: 'bru'i rgyun dang chos mthun phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la gal te 'chi ba'i srid pa kho na las yul gzhan dag tu skye ba'i srid pa 'byung bar 'dod na ni /

translated: If you assert that the birth existence occurs in another place from the death existence,

analyzed: de lta na skye ba'i srid pa mi srid pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /

original: rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di ltar rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i phyir dngos po rnams ni chad nas yul gzhan dag tu 'byung bar ma mthong ste /
translated: In fact, things are not seen to arise in another place after being interrupted, because they are connected by a stream.

original: dper na 'bru'i rgyun du gtogs pa'i 'bru'i 'bras bu rnams rgyun du 'brel bas rgyas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'bru'i rgyun du gtogs pa'i 'bru'i 'bras bu rnams rgyun du 'brel bas rgyas pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the fruit of the rice plant is connected by a stream to the rice plant.

original: 'di dag la rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i ngang tshul yod pas na rgyun gyis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag la rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i ngang tshul yod pas na rgyun gyis 'jug pa'o //
translated: They are connected by a stream because they have the nature of being connected by a stream.

original: yul gzhan dag tu zhes bya ba smos pa'i phyir sems kyi rgyun gyis ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gzhan dag tu zhes bya ba smos pa'i phyir sems kyi rgyun gyis ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin another place‚Äù is mentioned, so it is not uncertain that the stream of mind is interrupted.

original: 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i sems yod pa na dus gzhan du chad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i sems yod pa na dus gzhan du chad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When the mind arises from the meditative attainment of cessation or the meditative attainment of nonperception, it is said to arise after being interrupted for some time.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos pa rnams la yang gzugs skye ba yul gzhan du chad pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos pa rnams la yang gzugs skye ba yul gzhan du chad pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be said that form does not arise in another place after being interrupted when those who die in the formless realm are reborn.

original: rgyu'i gzugs las 'bras bu'i gzugs chad nas 'byung ba yang mthong ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i gzugs las 'bras bu'i gzugs chad nas 'byung ba yang mthong ste /
translated: And we see that a result form arises, having been cut off from the cause form.üîΩFor example, like a reflection from form.

original: dper na gzugs las gzugs brnyan bzhin zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'khrul pa las byung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs las gzugs brnyan bzhin zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'khrul pa las byung zhes pa'o //
translated: This is a cause that arises from error.

original: gzugs brnyan ma grub phyir ba dang / zhes bya ba 'dis brjod par 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ma grub phyir ba dang / zhes bya ba 'dis brjod par 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause a reflection is not established‚Äù shows that the example is inconclusive because it does not establish what it is supposed to prove.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena that have an object?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //

original: dmigs pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena that do not have an object?üîΩForm, the unconditioned, and the non-associated formative forces.

original: gzugs dang 'dus ma byas dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams so zhes bstan bcos las 'byung bas na gzugs brnyan sems dang sems las byung @341b ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs dang 'dus ma byas dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams so zhes bstan bcos las 'byung bas na gzugs brnyan sems dang sems las byung @341b ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir yod do zhe na /
translated: Since this is stated in the treatise, a reflection is an object of the mind and mental factors and therefore it exists.

original: 'di'i lan gyi phyir mi 'dra'i phyir na dpe ma yin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di'i lan gyi phyir mi 'dra'i phyir na dpe ma yin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: To answer this, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe example is not similar because they are not the same.‚Äù

original: kha dog gi khyad par gzhan zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kha dog gi khyad par gzhan zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúAnother color‚Äù means a different color.

original: me long gi kha dog las gzhan pa ni kha dog gi khyad par gzhan no //
analyzed: me long gi kha dog las gzhan pa ni kha dog gi khyad par gzhan no //
translated: The ‚Äúother color‚Äù is different from the color of the mirror.

original: tshig tsam gyis dad bar mi 'gyur bas 'dri ba ni re zhig ji ltar ma grub ce na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig tsam gyis dad bar mi 'gyur bas 'dri ba ni re zhig ji ltar ma grub ce na zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one cannot believe merely on the basis of words, the root text asks, ‚ÄúHow is it not established?‚Äù

original: yul de nyid na zhes bya ba la zur na gnas pas me long gi yul de nyid na me long gi gzugs mthong gi gzugs brnyan ma yin la mdun na gnas pas gzugs brnyan mthong gi me long gi gzugs ma yin te /
analyzed: yul de nyid na zhes bya ba la zur na gnas pas me long gi yul de nyid na me long gi gzugs mthong gi gzugs brnyan ma yin la mdun na gnas pas gzugs brnyan mthong gi me long gi gzugs ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that very place‚Äù means that one sees the form of the mirror in that very place where the mirror is, but not the reflection. One sees the reflection in the place where one is standing, but not the form of the mirror.

original: de ltar bsdoms pas der gnyis ka snang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar bsdoms pas der gnyis ka snang ngo //
translated: Thus, the two appear there in combination.

original: gzhan dag na re mdun du phyogs pas gnyis ka mthong ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mdun du phyogs pas gnyis ka mthong ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that one sees both because the reflection faces in both directions.

original: de'i phyir me long gcig na snang ba gnyis lhan cig tu mi srid pa'i phyir de na me long gi gzugs las gzugs brnyan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir me long gcig na snang ba gnyis lhan cig tu mi srid pa'i phyir de na me long gi gzugs las gzugs brnyan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is impossible for two images to appear in a single mirror, the reflection does not exist in the mirror as a form that is different from the mirror.

original: rten gyi 'byung ba tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la de gnyis kyi rten gyi 'byung ba rnams ni tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: rten gyi 'byung ba tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la de gnyis kyi rten gyi 'byung ba rnams ni tha dad pa yin la /
translated: Because the primary elements that are their supports are different.

original: me long gi gzugs kyi rten gyi 'byung ba rnams kyis gzung ba'i yul de na gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs kyi rten gyi 'byung ba rnams kyi go yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: me long gi gzugs kyi rten gyi 'byung ba rnams kyis gzung ba'i yul de na gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs kyi rten gyi 'byung ba rnams kyi go yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The primary elements that are the support of the reflection are not in the place occupied by the primary elements that are the support of the object.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are resistant.

original: de'i phyir de na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba ni med do //
translated: Therefore, two derivative forms do not occur together in the same place.

original: de bzhin du phyogs gzhan na gnas pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs gzhan na gnas pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Similarly, those who are situated in different directions.

original: phyogs tha dad pa na gnas pa'i skyes bu gcig gis rgyab kyi shing ljon pa la sogs pa'i gzugs ji ltar yin pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi yang de kho na ltar yin no //
analyzed: phyogs tha dad pa na gnas pa'i skyes bu gcig gis rgyab kyi shing ljon pa la sogs pa'i gzugs ji ltar yin pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi yang de kho na ltar yin no //
translated: The form of a tree, etc. that is situated behind one person is not situated in front of another person.

original: de la gcig gis ni rang gi mdun rol gyi yul na gnas pa'i shing ljon pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan dmigs kyi /
analyzed: de la gcig gis ni rang gi mdun rol gyi yul na gnas pa'i shing ljon pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan dmigs kyi /
translated: One of these sees the reflection of a form such as a tree that exists in the field in front of it.üîΩ

original: rgyab na gnas pa'i ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyab na gnas pa'i ma yin la /
translated: One sees the reflection of the form of a tree, etc., that is in front of it, but not that which is behind it.

original: cig shos kyis kyang mtshe'u'i chu'i yul de nyid du de kho na ltar dmigs so //
analyzed: cig shos kyis kyang mtshe'u'i chu'i yul de nyid du de kho na ltar dmigs so //
translated: The other sees the reflection of the form of the face in the same place, namely, in the water of the pond.

original: gal te de na chu'i gzugs ltar gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs dag kyang yod na ni gzugs thun mong ba yin pas thams cad kyis chu'i gzugs ci'i phyir ma dmigs /
analyzed: gal te de na chu'i gzugs ltar gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs dag kyang yod na ni gzugs thun mong ba yin pas thams cad kyis chu'i gzugs ci'i phyir ma dmigs /
translated: If the form of the reflection exists there in the same way as the form of the water, then the form is common to both and everyone should see both the form of the water and the reflection.

original: dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni 'khrul pa tsam zhig yin gyi gzugs gzhan ni ma yin no //üîΩyang grib @342a * //üîΩma dang nyi ma gnyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba la gang gi tshe me long grib man 'dug cing bsgribs pa ma yin pa'i tshe der nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan snang la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni 'khrul pa tsam zhig yin gyi gzugs gzhan ni ma yin no // yang grib @342a * // ma dang nyi ma gnyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba la gang gi tshe me long grib man 'dug cing bsgribs pa ma yin pa'i tshe der nyi ma'i gzugs brnyan snang la /
translated: Therefore, this is a mere error, and not another form.üîΩMoreover, when both the sun and the shade are present, etc.üîΩWhen a mirror is in the shade, the reflection of the sun appears in it, but not the reflection of the shade.

original: nyi ma la 'dug pa la grib ma snang na /
analyzed: nyi ma la 'dug pa la grib ma snang na /
translated: When the mirror is in the sun, the reflection of the shade appears in it, but not the reflection of the sun.

original: nyi ma dang grib ma dag ni lhan cig gnas par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyi ma dang grib ma dag ni lhan cig gnas par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for the sun and shade to exist together.

original: der yang der skye bzhin pa der dmigs pa ma yin te me long la gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: der yang der skye bzhin pa der dmigs pa ma yin te me long la gzugs bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, that which is in the process of arising there does not focus on that, like a reflection in a mirror.

original: gal te cung zad kyang med na /
analyzed: gal te cung zad kyang med na /
translated: If it does not exist in the least,

original: 'o na de ji ltar snang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ji ltar snang zhe na /
translated: then how does it appear?

original: de'i phyir gang de ltar snang ba de ni tshogs pa de'i mthu de 'dra ba yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang de ltar snang ba de ni tshogs pa de'i mthu de 'dra ba yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said that the power of that assembly is like that.

original: mthu dang nus pa dang nus mthu zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: mthu dang nus pa dang nus mthu zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
translated: Power, ability, and capacity have the same meaning.

original: ji ltar zhe na chos rnams kyi mthu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na chos rnams kyi mthu zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: How is that? It is said that the power of phenomena is like this.

original: ji ltar mig ser gyis mig nyams par byas pas thams cad du ser por mthong la /
analyzed: ji ltar mig ser gyis mig nyams par byas pas thams cad du ser por mthong la /
translated: For example, when the eye is damaged by jaundice, everything is seen as yellow.

original: rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis su mthong ba dang / ji ltar khab len kho nas lcags dag 'dren gyi gzhan gyis ma yin pa dang / zla ba shar na chu shel kho na las chu 'byung gi / sol ba la sogs pa dag las ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs gzhan med kyang mig dang me long gi ngos dang de'i bzhin gyi gzugs la brten nas de'i gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa can
analyzed: rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis su mthong ba dang / ji ltar khab len kho nas lcags dag 'dren gyi gzhan gyis ma yin pa dang / zla ba shar na chu shel kho na las chu 'byung gi / sol ba la sogs pa dag las ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs gzhan med kyang mig dang me long gi ngos dang de'i bzhin gyi gzugs la brten nas de'i gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa can
translated: Just as a person with myodesopsia sees two moons, just as only a magnet attracts iron and not other things, and just as water only arises from a crystal when the moon rises and not from charcoal and so on, in the same way, though the other form does not exist, the aspect of the reflection of that form arises in dependence on the eye, the surface of the mirror and the form of the face.üîΩ

original: gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Just as a person with an eye disease sees two moons, or just as a magnet attracts iron but not other things, or just as water appears only from a water crystal, not from charcoal, in the same way, even though the form is not different, the eye consciousness having the aspect of the reflection of that form arises in dependence on the form of the eye and the surface of the mirror.

original: 'di la 'ga' zhig na re /
analyzed: 'di la 'ga' zhig na re /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: gcig na lhan cig gnyis med phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig na lhan cig gnyis med phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because two things do not exist simultaneously in one place.

original: khyed cag rnams nyid kyis lan du byas pa tshogs pa'i mthu las de dang 'dra bar snang ba gang yin pa ni yul tha dad pa dag tu yang me long la gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs dag tha mi dad pa'i yul du mthong bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'di la khyed cag kho nas lan du byas pa tshogs pa'i mthu kho na las de 'dra bar snang ngo zhes bya'o //

analyzed: gzugs gzhan ni gzugs brnyan la sgrib par byed de /

analyzed: rang gi yul du gzhan bskyed pa'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: gal te @343a * //
analyzed: gal te @343a * //

analyzed: gang gi phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par shes pa rnams dang myu gu la sogs pa rnams yod pa nyid du grub pas 'di yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid du blta'o //

analyzed: dbu ba bzhin kha dog gi rten la gnas pa nyid du mthong ngo //

analyzed: gal te zla ba la sogs pa la gegs byed pa med na chu la sogs pa la gzugs brnyan skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bsgribs pa rnams la yang skye bar 'gyur ro //

translated: The intermediate existence is without body and without object, like the arising of the aggregates in another place, following the mind, like the mind of one who dreams, etc.

analyzed: de'i phyir mchod par gzugs brnyan skye'o zhes bya ba 'di srid pa bar ma'i dpe ma yin no //

analyzed: 'dir rnam par bshad pa ni gang dag la dogs pa yod pa rang nyid kyis khas blangs te so sor bsgrub par byas so //
translated: Here, the explanation is that the doubts that exist are individually resolved by accepting them.

original: rgyun min phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la gal te gzugs brnyan gzugs kyi rgyun gyi khongs su gtogs pa yin na ni me @343b long gi rgyud dang ma 'brel par gzugs dang 'brel pa kho nar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyun min phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la gal te gzugs brnyan gzugs kyi rgyun gyi khongs su gtogs pa yin na ni me @343b long gi rgyud dang ma 'brel par gzugs dang 'brel pa kho nar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the reflection were included in the continuum of form, then it would arise in a connection with form alone, without being connected to the continuum of the mirror.

analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa ni gzhan gyi rgyu dang 'brel te 'byung bar mi rigs so //

analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir yang gzugs brnyan gzugs kyi rgyun ma yin te /

analyzed: ji ltar 'chi ba'i srid pa'i rgyun skye ba'i srid pa lta bu ste de gnyis ni lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: For example, it is like the continuum of existence at death arising as the continuum of existence at birth, but those two do not arise simultaneously.

analyzed: rgyun la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /

analyzed: rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i 'bru dper brjod pa la gzugs brnyan rgyun du gyur pa ma yin pas phyir bzlog pas dpe mi 'dra ba yin no //

original: gzugs brnyan gyi gtso bo'i rgyu gang yin pa ni me long la sogs pa ste de'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar gal te ral gri bsags kar bsnyal te 'dug pa yin na ni gzugs brnyan yang bsags kar ring bar snang la /

translated: The primary cause of a reflection is a mirror, etc., because it is the basis of the reflection.üîΩIf a sword is placed in a box, the reflection of the sword appears to be in the box.

original: gal te gyen la 'greng ste 'dug pa yin na ni gzugs brnyan yang de ltar snang ngo //üîΩrgyu gnyis pa gtso bo ma yin pa khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa yod do zhe na de'i phyir gtso bo'i rgyu gang yang rung ba zhig dang zhes bya ba smos so /
analyzed: gal te gyen la 'greng ste 'dug pa yin na ni gzugs brnyan yang de ltar snang ngo // rgyu gnyis pa gtso bo ma yin pa khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa yod do zhe na de'i phyir gtso bo'i rgyu gang yang rung ba zhig dang zhes bya ba smos so /
translated: If the sword is standing upright, the reflection appears to be standing upright.üîΩThe primary cause of a reflection is a mirror, etc., because it is the basis of the reflection.üîΩIf the primary cause is semen, blood, etc., then the phrase ‚Äúany primary cause‚Äù is used.

original: ci ste yang khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa kho na gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa kho na gtso bo yin te /

analyzed: gzhan dag na re / mi 'dra'i phyir na dpe ma yin zhes bya ba rgyu'i rjes su byed pas gzugs brnyan 'jig par 'gyur gyi 'chi kha ma'i phung po 'gags pas skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i phung po med par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: But others say:

analyzed: de lta ma yin na sems can gyi rgyud rgyun chad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not an example because it is not similar. The form of a reflection is destroyed because it is produced in dependence on a cause. The aggregates at death do not cease and the aggregates at birth do not arise because the continuum of sentient beings would be severed if that were so.

original: gzugs brnyan gzugs dang 'dra bar 'byung na /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gzugs dang 'dra bar 'byung na /

analyzed: bas dpe 'dra ba yod pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //

translated: Because it is stated in the scriptures means because it is stated in the scriptures of the Bhagavat.üîΩThey do not recite this sutra means that other schools that deny the existence of the intermediate state, etc., do not accept it, even though it is renowned in other schools.

analyzed: sdud pa'i bzhi po nyams pas lhag par sgro btags par dogs pas tshad mar mi byed de de dag gi lung gi khongs su ma 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
